name: Katie
description: Katie is a real character. She's super playful and full of funny antics. She still acts like a kitten.  She's a quiet, low maintenance cat.  She prances into and out of her carrier without assistance, is a good traveler, and is eager to meet each new royal adventure. She prefers to be the ruler of her own castle, but will tolerate other cats.  To meet her or for more information, please call (561) 784-4792.

name: Tessie
description:
Tessie was born 8/23/2005 and is a little teaser. She is very friendly but seems to be afraid of dogs and a little intimidated by aggressive cats. Tessie just wants to be a lap cat and have someone play with her. She had been locked in a cage for almost a year but is now running free in a foster home.

Although she is getting up in age, she can still be active and loves to play.  However, you do not have to worry about her climbing your curtains or furniture because she is "Mature", and mature cats don't do those things.

Tess has been in foster care since she was a baby.  She really needs a lifetime family of her own.

If you want more information, please send an email to paws@oplink.net.  Our website is www.pawsrescue.org where each rescued pet has their own webpage.

name: Nancy
description:
Hello, my name is Nancy. I guess I was named after Nancy Drew because I'm very inquisitive and always checking things out. I also love to play with my toys and I especially like catnip.

Nancy is a little shy at first, but then is very affectionate and gets along with everyone and is incredibly sweet!

**Please Note: We are only able to adopt within 30-40 miles of Baltimore, MD. For more information on our adoption policies, please go to http://www.petrescueofmd.org/info/adoption

name: Chester
description: Chester is one of a kind. He is known as the resident “bad boy,” but don’t let that fool you. Chester can be an absolute sweetheart. I personally believe that Chester likes having the “bad boy” label, so he doesn’t want everyone to see his sweet side (because it might ruin his “bad boy” rep). With the right kind of attention, Chester will lick your hand, arm, ear, neck, hair and anything he can find to show you that he loves you! He will wrap his furry paw and arm around your arm to hold you closer to show his affection as well. Chester does have a tendency to play rough, so he should probably be the only cat in the house. But, with the right kind of attention, you will see right through Chester’s bad boy rep and see the sweet, affectionate Chester! Please come visit this “bad boy” and give him the home he so deserves!

name: KATIE
description:
DOB 6/05.

Katie was abandoned by her owners at a vet's office when they discovered she had feline leukemia (FeLV). The vet just happened to tell her story to a client who was also a DKC volunteer. The volunteer immediately took her to DKC and Katie has lived there every since.

Katie is a shy, timid girl who loves attention and affection. To the right person, she would be a wonderful companion. Katie will do well with another positive cat or as an only cat. She needs a quiet home and a patient person who will take their time with her. In time, her loving personality will blossom to the fullest extent.

FeLV+ cats can lead long, happy, and healthy lives. To learn more about caring for a leukemia positive cat, please read this article.

Katie would like to have a guardian angel.


For all pet inquiries and for faster service, please contact the Adoption Director by email at adoptions@dognkittycity.org. If you need to speak with someone, you can call the shelter and leave a message at 214-350-7387. If you are interested in adopting this pet you will need to submit a filled-in adoption application (dognkittycity.org/2/adoption-application.html) to the Adoption Director in person, by email, or by fax at 214-484-6695.

Adoption Director
Email: adoptions@dognkittycity.org
Fax:     214-484-6695		 Dog & Kitty City
dognkittycity.org
2719 Manor Way
Dallas, Texas 75235

Phone: 214-350-7387
Hours: Daily 11:45-5. Closed holidays.

Please note that many of our dogs are at off-site adopt-a-pets on Saturdays, and some of our pets are in foster homes or other off-site adoption locations, such as PetSmart. Please email us to verify that the pet you are interested in is at the shelter prior to visiting us. GREATER DALLAS INQUIRIES ONLY, PLEASE!

If you are interested to help us continue to provide assistance for homeless pets, please make a donation.

name: TOPENGA
description:
DOB 4/05

Sweet Topenga, with her huge eyes, precious pink nose, and adoring (and adorable) expressions! She is a congenial cat who loves attention from a kind human. She is also agile on the playing field, scoring some impressive interceptions of fast-rolling jingle balls.

Having raised two babies of her own, plus taken on two others (that's her motherly nature), Topenga is surely ready for a home of her own. A playful, joyous girl, she also knows about quiet time and does catnaps quite well.

Come meet her and see for yourself what a doll she is.

name: ADOPTION-Read First
description:
This is what you get when you adopt a kitty from RescueCats - WWW.RESCUECATS.ORG
A kitten or a cat that has been spayed or neutered, treated for fleas & worms, microchipped, vaccinated for RCP & Rabies(if old enough) & tested negative for FeLV/FIV, and some older kitties have had dental cleanings.
**Petfinder/Purina/Petsmart email gift:
NEW ADOPTERS get UP TO $190+ WORTH OF *Coupon SAVINGS:
*Free small bag of Purina® Pro Plan® food
*Free small bag of any Purina® food*
*Free package of Purina® Tidy Cats® or Pro Plan® litter (cats only)
*20% off PetSmart® purchase
*$10 off PetSmart® grooming
*Free 30-minute private session with a PetSmart® - Accredited Pet Trainer (dogs only)
PETSMART Adoption Starter Kit - Over $400 in extra savings - Includes free coupon for Simply Nourish or Authority Cat food up to 7lbs. and coupons for most of the needed supplies.
Animal Planet DVD
Advantage II Offer
Scratching Pad Offer
Cat Attract Litter Coupons
Coupons for BLUE Cat Food
 Cardboard Carrier plus a Toy from RescueCats
A Canvas Bag with Coupons from Tractor Supply (while supplies last)- Out of stock
 
Adoption Center - All Week

PETsMART, Morrow, GA

(I-75/Mt Zion Rd) 1986 Mount Zion Rd- Morrow, GA

Saturday 4/14/18 thru Saturday 4/21/18-

Meet and adopt:
AUTUMN, OREO, GRETA, MINX, MIMI

 

WEEKEND Adoption Fair- 

PETsMART, Morrow, GA - 1986 Mt. Zion Road

Adoption Fairs held at the Morrow PETSMART each Saturday from 11:00am - 4:00pm - featuring 15-20 adoptable cats.
 
 
To make sure the cat or kitten of your dreams does not slip through your fingers.
1) Fill out an adoption form  2) Call RescueCats at 678-817-9647 or Jerri at 404-304–9210 to make sure the kitty is still available or e-mail rescuecats@hotmail.com or Jerri at JerriClay@gmail.com  3) After receiving confirmation, a deposit of at least $50/cat or kitten plus a $3.00 PayPal fee is required and can be made online using PayPal. A link can be found at the bottom of the adoption form. 4. Don't have a PayPal account? You can either mail a money order to RescueCats, Inc PO Box 142882 Fayetteville Ga 30214, include the name(s) of the kitty/kitties. Another option is to bring the deposit in CASH to PETsMART in Morrow at the adoption fair every Saturday from 11AM to 4 PM. Please Note 1. All deposits are absolutely not refundable 2. Should the cat of your choice be no longer available, you will be given first choice of all available cats or wait and select among any new arrivals. 3. Priority is given to anyone willing to adopt more than one cat/kitten. Kittens, especially very small kittens, are much much happier when adopted with a sibling or buddy. 4. By the time most kittens are old enough to leave their foster homes, they have all been tested for FIV/FeLV, treated for worms, fleas and ear mites, spayed/neutered and immunized as appropriate for their age. All of which would cost well over $200 if paid directly to a vet.// Age and Size Guide: Baby: 0-6 months. Young: 6-24 months. Adult: 2-10 years. Senior: over 10 years. Small: 0-6 pounds. Medium: 7-12 pounds. Large: 13 - 25 pounds. Extra Large: over 25 pounds. If you don't see what you're looking for, please call and ask because we may have what you want. Adoption fees range from $110-$250.

name: Maple
breed: Pit Bull Terrier / Labrador Retriever / Mixed (short coat)
description:
Happy Hills Animal Foundation, Inc

www.hhaf.org


Maple is searching for a new home. This is her second time at the HHAF shelter. Maple's adotive "daddy" has had to return her after 5 years due to his own health issues. Maple is adjusting well back to the routine of shelter life. She wants more than anything to once again have a family to care for her. She is searching for a family that can give the stable and structured life that she seeks. This girl is basic obedienced trained and she prefers that her human's be the "leader of the pack". She is loving and has the tendency to be protective of the people in her life.


336-622-3620

office@hhaf.org

name: FOSTERS NEEDED
description:
***FOSTER HOMES NEEDED***


***Click here for >> Foster Application***


Eskie Rescuers United rescues stray, orphaned, unwanted or abused Eskies from humane societies, pounds, shelters, or from owners who need to find a new home for their Eskies. We are ALWAYS in need of foster homes for these dogs until they can be adopted. It's vacation season and people are leaving town- and dumping their dogs!! We're desperate for foster homes-- help!!

The primary role of the foster home is to evaluate the new Eskie as to health, behavior and temperament, as follows:

HEALTH
Determine what medical needs the Eskie has, such as routine vaccinations, heartworm tests (and heartworm treatment, if necessary), being spayed/neutered, having their teeth cleaned, etc. In the case of our more severely abused or neglected dogs, the foster home ensures that the dog gets the medical attention required to get him/her back to optimal health.

BEHAVIOR AND TEMPERAMENT
1. Evaluate the dog for behavioral issues and work to correct any undesirable traits exhibited by the dog. These may include not being housebroken, needing basic obedience training (including learning to walk on a leash), excessive barking, etc.

2. Evaluate the dog's temperament: is he/she friendly, aggressive, shy, scared, submissive? How does the dog get along with other dogs, cats, children, men, women, strangers, and so on? The foster home will then be responsible for providing the proper training and socialization needed to make the dog adoptable.

After the assessment and vetting of the dog, the foster home provides ERU with bio information and pictures, so the dog can be posted on ERU's website and on Petfinder.com. Sometimes our foster homes also participate in adoption events that provide additional exposure both to the foster dog and to Eskie Rescuers United.

ERU pays for the cost of all vetting and medical needs of our foster dogs, including heartworm and flea/tick medications. The foster home provides for the dog's food, treats and toys and is not reimbursed for those expenses by ERU.

Fostering a rescue dog can be a lot of work and responsibility. Some of these dogs were never provided proper socialization or medical care, and therefore are not perfectly behaved or impeccably groomed. MANY of our fosters come from deplorable situations and may need a lot of tender loving care to get them cleaned up, be taught how to trust again, or just simply realize what it's like to be loved and cherished!

Before applying to become a new foster home, please ask yourself (and your family members) if you have enough time and patience, as well as the understanding of the Eskie breed, to care properly for a rescue dog. Fostering can be an incredibly rewarding labor of love, and you can make all the difference in the world to the dog(s) you foster.

If you are interested in fostering an Eskie, please go to: our website, www.eskierescuers.org and sign-in and complete a foster application. Thank you for your interest in wanting to help care for these beautiful white dogs!

"Saving just one dog won't change the world...
...but surely, the world will change for that one dog!"

Whenever possible Eskie Rescuers United tries to adopt out its dogs locally (or at least to adopters in adjoining states to where I'm being fostered). Please note that ERU processes LOCAL adoption applications before considering those from out of state.

If I'm not local to you, as explained above, and you really have your heart set on me, you will have to make special arrangements so ERU can get me to you safely (for example, flying me to you at your own expense, or paying a transport group to drive me to you). Note: We may ask that you to make a donation to cover transport costs if the distance is great and we have trouble finding transport drivers.

There is an adoption fee required; and, please be aware, Eskie Rescuers United will not adopt out its dogs as outdoor dogs.

Eskie Rescuers United American Eskimo Dog Rescue, Inc. is an IRS-approved 501(c)(3) non-profit organization. Please click the donation button below to make a tax-deductible donation through PayPal and help make a difference to even one American Eskimo dog!

name: Britta
description:
Britta is a 4 yr. old girl who is looking for a furever family. This sweet girl was dumped at San Gabriel Shelter with her sister & both were lucky to be saved. She's beat the odds once & is ready to do it again by finding her furever home. Britta promises to light up your life with her happy demeanor & love for life.  She is best in a home with another male dog her size or by herself.  She just so badly wants to find someone or a family to love her!  She is a great dog and just full of love and life!


Interested in adopting this pet? Please contact us at questions@awishforanimals.org for more info.

description:

name: FOSTER A BOXER!
description:
The dogs shown in this picture are not up for adoption. They are part of the Rockin' P Rescue program. Can you believe that they were found at one of the high-kill shelters?! They were rescued and lived in foster homes until we could find a new family for them. We are in desperate need of quality families in the AL/GA area to temporarily care for boxers waiting for their forever homes. Currently, we are having to turn dogs away from our program because we have nowhere for them to go. This could ultimately mean these dogs will be put to sleep. Fostering a boxer is a truly rewarding experience - please open your door, and your heart, to a boxer in need. If you cannot foster and have a large crate you'd like to donate, please let us know! We can use it to save a life! Send an e-mail to rockinp@microxl.com for more info.

Not ready to adopt me?  How would you like to be my sponsor?!  Our medical bills are at an all-time high and even a $5 donation can help take some of my cousins off the street, treat their wounds and heal their hearts.  Please think about a tax-deductible donation today!

name: FOSTERS NEEDED
description:
PLEASE NOTE: GPMR communicates primarily by email.  If you have any questions regarding one of our Mastiffs, please read their bio and if you still have questions- drop us an email at info@greatplainsmastiffrescue.org .  If you have questions about our adoption procedures, please go to our Pages of Interest on the left hand column under "Adoption Info."  We answer email inquiries almost immediately-usually always within a few hours and phone calls are returned with 24-36 hours. 
 
GPMR does not have a shelter. All of our dogs are kept in loving foster homes. We must have a completed adoption
application on file before meeting any of our mastiffs.
  
GPMR adopts to the states of Oklahoma, Texas, Kansas, Arkansas, Missouri, Louisiana and parts of Colorado. 
!!!Any mastiffs being adopted out of the state of Oklahoma require a health certificate to be paid for by the adopter!!!
 

 

 

Need Volunteers for Fostering:

GPMR does not have a shelter or facility where we can house Mastiffs when they come into rescue. We are able to take Mastiffs into rescue because of our caring volunteers who foster those Mastiffs until they can find their forever home.

IF YOU CAN HELP FOSTER, OR VOLUNTEER IN ANY WAY, PLEASE FILL OUT OUR ONLINE VOLUNTEER AND/OR FOSTER FORM. WE NEED DEDICATED VOLUNTEERS SO WE CAN HELP MORE MASTIFFS IN NEED.

THANK YOU!

Note: the dog pictured is a previously adopted dog - please go to   http://www.greatplainsmastiffrescue.org/animals/list?Status=Available
for the current list of dogs, and there are always dogs waiting to come into the rescue when we have a foster home available - please consider fostering tday!

name: Gilda
description:
DOB: 6/20/2003

This gorgeous, lovely girl needs a new home after losing the one she had. Gilda is accustomed to being alone during the day and could be content in a one-cat household.

Gilda was trapped as a kitten while living with a feral group on the edge of a schoolyard. She was not wild, however, and ready to play as soon as released. She had been attacked by some other animal and had deep wounds on her face and neck. With antibiotics she healed completely without scarring. Gilda is a glamour girl as cats go. She knows, it seems, how beautiful she is, and plays the prima donna among the other cats in her foster home. She is a spirited cat—active, alert and curious. She loves to "help" with any house-hold activity underway, especially at the computer, then cuddle on the sofa for TV time.

  She was adopted shortly after being rescued, but sadly for her, was returned when her adopter received a job assignment requiring stays in Europe. Gilda was confused and upset at losing what she thought was her forever home. She has regained her composure and is in need of another home where she can feel secure and loved again. She is still a sweet, affectionate cat, and as lovely as ever.

If you are interested in learning more about Gilda, please email her foster mom.


If you are unable to send an email to the foster parent through the link included above, please contact us and let us know what kitty you're interested in.  You may also fill out our adoption questionnaire to speed up the screening process.  Be sure to name the cat in the CAT PREFERENCE field at the beginning of the questionnaire. If the above links aren't live, our contact form and questionnaire are available on our website at www.kittenrescue.org.

For our fees and adoption policies and procedures, please click here.

name: Outdoor Cats
description:
Do you have a ranch, barn, greenhouse, workshop or studio that could be a safe haven for a feral cat or two? We often have a few cats in our care who have lived their whole lives outdoors, and are not comfortable in our adoption center. They will have already been spayed/neutered, and immunized. If you can provide food, water and shelter for feral cats who needs a safe, secure outdoor home, please contact us. We recommend a good cat fencing system that can be used for outdoor cats or for your indoor cats who want a safe outdoor adventure.

Animal Friends Rescue Project operates an Adoption Center at 160 Fountain Ave in Pacific Grove, CA along with satellite cat adoption centers at Pet Food Express in Carmel, CA; Petco in Monterey, CA; and Pet Supplies Plus in Pacific Grove, CA.

For the quickest response, Please fill out an online application through our website www.animalfriendsrescue.org. Our adoption fee for cats is $0 - $150; our adoption fee for dogs is $150 - $300.

name: Erin
description:
**Please Note: We are only able to adopt within 30-40 miles of the Baltimore, MD area.**

UPDATE: Although Erin will never be a cat you can hug and snuggle with, she is turning into an affectionate cat. She runs to the door to meet her foster mom and dad when they come home. She likes to sleep right next to her foster mom or dad and spends a lot of time sitting next to them when they watch TV. She enjoys attention if you allow her to rub against you and pet her head gently. She doesn't do well with rough play. She would do best as the only pet in the household.

Erin was out on the mean streets of Baltimore city after being abused and abandoned. We have learned that Erin is a bit of a Diva and likes to have things her way. She likes to be petted, until she doesn't, and then she lets you know she's had enough. Erin will need someone who is very patient and willing to work with her to earn her trust and affection. She has beautiful calico markings and a colorful personality to match.

**For information about our adoption policies and procedures, please go to http://www.petrescueofmd.org/info/adoption.

name: Jade
description:
Get ready for the greatest love of your life!!!

Please learn more about us and our available pets at Robin Hood Animal Rescue.


In Jade's words:

  • “I have a sad story, but I still want to believe that I will have a happy ending.
  • I have had two families and each time there was something happening in their lives that made them give me up.
  • Although they gave me up, Robin Hood Animal Rescue hasn't given up on me.
  • My foster mom tells me that I have the sense of a deep green jade stone about me.
  • She tells me that I radiates with the mystery of a jade stone.
  • I tend to me a quiet girl.
  • I was attacked twice by other dogs so now I tend to be leery of others unless they are submissive.
  • Please let me show you what a delight I will be to your family.”

As with all our foster dog children, Jade has been altered, micro chipped and has had her shots.

Please call or text Bob at (623) 680-1170 for more information on this extra special older girl.


MARCH 2018: THE USUAL ADOPTION FEE FOR DOGS/PUPPIES VARIES GIVEN AGE, BREED, ETC.. All have been spay/neutered, vaccinated and microchipped. 

OUR ADOPTION FEE FOR MANY OF OUR ADULT CATS WILL START AT $75.00.  All have been spay/neutered, FIV/leukemia tested, vaccinated and microchipped.

If you find one who has taken your heart, please call us at (623) 680-1170. *We will adopt out of state.*

Donations can be made via PayPal by clicking on the above button or through our website: www.RobinHoodAnimalRescue.org

Or if like, donations can be made via GoFundMe by clicking on the link on our website (bottom of page): www.RobinHoodAnimalRescue.org

If you would like to make a donation via check please make your check payable to: Robin Hood Animal Rescue and text or call Bob at (623) 680-1170.

Donations are used for medical, supplies, food and other operating expenses. Everyone here at Robin Hood Animal Rescue (two and four legged/furry and not as furry) thank you in advance.

name: Tali
description:
Sweet senior girl Tali has gone through some huge changes in her family home and is no longer comfortable so her loving momma is hoping to find her a more quiet, calm home for her to live out her senior years. A retired person/couple wanting a loyal, cuddle companion is the ideal home for her, with no small, or active children to disrupt her rest time.

Xolos are super companions for those who want a devoted dog, extremely loyal, very loving an affectionate and do not require much exercise. Tali is house trained and good with other dogs, she loves nothing more than snuggling under a blanket in her mom's lap. She does require some skin care and protection, her mom has a great routine in place for such care. 

The Mexican Hairless lives about a 12-15 years and requires protection from both overheating and cooling. This breed requires a sweater in cool weather and needs protection from sunburn. All must be protected from excessive sunlight, heat and cold, and all have dental problems related to their hairless condition. These curious dogs are amongst the only canines who sweat through their skin. Their body temperatures tend to be higher than predicted as well. This dog breed requires attention from family members, who will be rewarded with a loving and devoted companion.

name: Dusty Rose
breed: Tortoiseshell / Domestic Short Hair / Mixed (short coat)
description:
Please contact Linda (catresq@twcny.rr.com), (315) 457-4420 for more information about this pet.

Doesn’t she have outstanding colors? This senior girl enjoys pets, having her head scratched, and is much more friendly once she knows her human. She was rescued as a kitten from a hoarder home (born May 2006), and has spent her life at our rescue. She has been extremely difficult to show, because when adopters come over she hides! This has led to her being overlooked time and again. She comes back out after the adopter leaves having chosen another cat. If you wouldn’t mind that she hides from strangers then this special lady would love a chance to spend the rest of her days being your companion. Just give her a bit to adjust to your house and routine. She would adore a nice window.

If you would like to consider giving Dusty Rose a comfortable home of her own, please fill out our adoption application at www.kittycorner.org

All of our cats come with our “cat-back guarantee”.  If she doesn’t work out, or needs to be rehomed at any time, just return her to us.

 

Dusty Rose tests negative for feline leukemia and FIV, has been spayed and microchipped, and all vaccines are up to date.

name: Sarah
description:
Please contact Linda (catresq@twcny.rr.com), (315) 457-4420 for more information about this pet.

 

Senior cat seeks retirement home with soft place to hang out, and nice person to snuggle with. Sarah is a friendly, loving, cuddly, and gentle cat who likes to sit on laps here at the rescue.  She may be a bit reserved upon meeting a new person, but given the occasion to she would surely bond with her new human.  Sarah was originally brought to Kitty Corner as a pregnant mom who gave birth here. She has been living at our rescue while waiting for a home of her own. Born around 2004. She tolerates other cats, but does not require their company.  We feel she may have a slight preference to be an only cat, however she may get along with another cat who isn't overly dominant or aggressive.  She has some arthritis. She is looking for a human companion to spend rest of her days with. Could that be you?

If you would like to meet Sarah, or any of our other adoptable cats, please fill out the adoption application at www.kittycorner.org.

Kitty Corner has a lifetime return policy . If your adopted cat needs to be rehomed at any time, just bring them back to us. We want to be sure that none of our cats is ever homeless again.

Sarah tests negative for feline leukemia and FIV, has been spayed, microchipped, and all shots are up to date.

Thanks for considering adopting our cats!

I was adopted 7 years ago and brought back because my owners had a baby so I had to go.
I am Cocker Spaniel/Min Pin Mix. I am very sweet and still playful. I have been around other dogs and kids.

All dogs are spayed/neutered, current on vaccinations, dewormed, and are treated with advantix for fleas and ticks. They are also micro chipped.

name: Mary
description:
Mary is a very cute Rat Terrier mix. She was born jan 14 2006. Mary was given up by her owners as they had no time to take care of her. Her brother, Peter is also for adoption. Mary has a wonderful temperament and personality. She loves to play and she has been socialized with other dogs.
She is an active dog and will require a fenced yard to play and run around.


  • Dogs are up-to-date on shots, wormed, on heartworm preventative, microchipped and altered(spayed/neutered), prior to adoption.
  • Our pets are kept  at our adoption center and viewed by pre-arranged appointment by approved applicants only.
  • Cats are up-to-date on shots, wormed, tested for FELV & FIV, microchipped and altered prior to adoption.
  • Many of our cats are kept in foster homes and are not necessarily available for viewing at Pet Supplies Plus (Carmel Commons), Charlotte, NC. Cats in foster homes are viewed by pre-arranged appointment by approved applicants only.
  • QUICKER RESPONSES FOR INQUIRIES ARE VIA EMAILS.  terisluvs@aol.com
  • We accept CASH ONLY for ADOPTION FEES. ADOPTION FEES FOR PETS WILL BE LISTED INDIVIDUALLY.  An additional $15 fee is required at the time of addoption for microchip registration.
  • Please complete an ON-LINE APPLICATION before inquiring about a pet.

name: Hope
breed: Domestic Long Hair / Maine Coon / Mixed (long coat)
description:
Hope is a shy girl, but she is coming to trust people. She is affectionate in her own way, wanting to be with you but is not a lap sitter. She is alert, playful, good with dogs and tolerates other cats. Poor Hope does not bother a soul but the other cats like to pick on her.  She would love to have a home of her home where she can be appreciated and loved.  If you are the kind of adopter that will let a cat blossom, please contact Cathy at info@purrfectfriendscatrescue.org or call her at (513) 617-9586.
 UPDATE: 4/12/11  Hope has gone to a new foster home with less cats and has just blossomed.  She plays and wants attention.  She will come and rub on you and loves to talk.  She enjoys sleeping in the bed and a little basket she found in the living room.  I am overjoyed that she is now more outgoing and enjoys being petted.  I never knew she had a voice until now.  She is so talkative.  I cannot tell you how thrilled I am that she is becoming so outgoing!!  Just give her a chance and she will melt your heart too.  Born in 2007, she is spayed, microchipped, vaccinated and negative for fiv/felv.  Adoption fee $50.  Fill out our application at http://www.purrfectfriendscatrescue.org/adoptform.html

name: Guinness
description:
Please contact Linda (catresq@twcny.rr.com), (315) 457-4420 for more information about this pet.

Shy Cat:

Please contact Linda (catresq@twcny.rr.com), (315) 457-4420 for more information about this pet.Shy Cat:

Guinness is shy meeting people for the first time! He's a gorgeous black cat, tall and sleek. It might take a little time to get over his shyness, but once he trusts you he is a faithful friend. He enjoys pets, but he is often too busy to sit on laps, He would make a nice roommate for a busy person. Guinness gets along well with other cats. He enjoys their company, and would probably like to have at least one feline sibling in his family, but he could adjust to being an only cat.

Background info- I was born at Kitty Corner June 23, 2007. My mom was pregnant when she was thrown out of a car in front of the Blarney Stone in Tipp Hill, Syracuse. Mom went into labor, and a nice person helped mom out and brought her to Kitty Corner to care for her and her kittens.  I have been living here at the rescue since I was a kitten. I have been waiting for my turn to be adopted all of my life.

 If you would like to give this senior a chance to have a comfortable retirement home of his own, please fill out the adoption application at www.kittycorner.org 

Guinness tests negative for Feline Leukemia and FIV, is neutured, microchipped, and up to date on vaccines.

If your cat needs to be rehomed at any time, just bring them back to us. We want to be sure that none of our cats is ever homeless again.

Thank you for looking at our cats! 4/13/18 9:37 PM

name: Solomon *Adoption Pending*
description:
Solomon is a handsome teddy bear of a guy! Despite being a big boy, Solomon is such a gentle soul. He is just so happy and sweet! He has so much going for him; he is house-trained, crate-trained, quiet in the home, and has wonderful house-manners. He rides easily in the car and loves going for car rides. He is great to walk on leash (does not pull). Solomon has attended obedience classes at Mountain View Veterinary Health Center. He has learned so many fun, new tricks and is very smart!

Solomon is very loyal and bonds well with his family, but he can jump a 6 foot fence so he's one of the few dogs we will let go to an un-fenced yard. He must be supervised when outdoors or tethered safely for potty breaks. He must go to a home where everyone is responsible enough to ensure he does not get the opportunity to wander away. Solomon is not good with cats.

Solomon is about 10 years old now (Mar 2018)and is a Yellow Labrador Retriever mix. Don't let 10 years deceive you, he can still act very puppyish when the mood strikes and loves to romp and play with other dogs, not to mention go for hikes in the mountains!

Solomon's adoption fee is $150 which includes his neuter surgery and vaccinations (distemper and rabies). If you would like to meet Solomon, please call Lisa at (435) 752-3534 (leave a message) or email us at scfourpaws@hotmail.com. Please be patient with us getting get back to you as we are all volunteers with full-time jobs.

Thank you for your interest in deserving Solomon!!

name: Miss Moppet
breed: Domestic Medium Hair / Maine Coon (medium coat)
description:
Soft, soft fur, quiet, loving
The beautiful Miss Moppet is looking for someone who wants to focus on her. She doesn't need constant attention--and she'd be fine as an only cat. That said, we should point out that she does love her cuddling time.  She is a beautiful, probably Maine Coon Mix kitty - just look at her wonderful soft fur and bright, happy eyes!

Miss Moppett was part of a feral cat colony in town.  The caretaker never realized how sweet and tame she was, because the colony was in an alley behind a street full of stores where she was always dodging traffic, hiding, and coming out only at night.

Moppet delivered four adorable kittens on the day she was rescued, and what she is hoping for now is a loving family in a home all her own, maybe with some children to dote on her; however, she does get along very well with other cats.  Moppet is super sweet and very playful - a lot of fun to have around. She can't wait for people to come in and pet her, she's extremely gentle, and she loves to be cuddled and loved. 

Come to meet the lovely Muppet and see if you'd like to adopt her and whisk her away. Just click the adoption link, then fill out the online application. She'll be looking forward to meeting you!

To adopt her, go to her webpage at www.happycatadoptions.org and under her photo, click the adoption link, then fill out the online application. She'll be looking forward to meeting you!

For more information, contact her foster dad: haroldw1@sbcglobal.net.

name: WI/IL Foster Homes Needed
description:
URGENT-HELP NEEDED Illinois & Wisconsin... 

WE ARE IN NEED OF FOSTER HOMES FOR ADULT DOGS, PREGNANT DOGS & PUPPIES!  TAKE YOUR PICK- MANY TO CHOOSE FROM AGES 6 WEEKS TO 3 YEARS.

Licensed by the state of Illinois & Wisconsin #266969-DS-Licensed by the State of Illinois #087-15060- 501C3 NON-PROFIT

 

K9 Lifeline Rescue, Inc. is a 501(c)3 non-profit, State Licensed, all volunteer organization based out of SE WI who are reaching out to the public for more foster homes. The Rescue is down to our lowest number of foster homes in 5 years. Sadly, the demand for more homes is high, in large part due to the struggling economy and the added burden of homeless dogs in area Shelters.

 

K9 Lifeline Rescue+ volunteer foster homes can request either large, medium or small breed dogs or puppies to foster and can also specify a certain breed. K9LLR provides our foster homes with crates. We also vaccinate and alter all of our dogs and puppies at the expense of the Rescue. You as the foster family, simply provide a safe, loving home for a dog in need until a permanent home is found.

 

In addition to our dire need of more foster homes, we also have a great need for volunteers able to assist with transporting of the pups from one place to another- we reimburse $$ for transports! We also have the need for website maintenance, AND someone who has the "knack" to find us more veterinarians to help us!

For more information e-mail K9LifelineRescue@aol.com or visit our website www.K9Lifeline.com



(ALL the pups in the pictures have been ADOPTED- however, there are many, many more that look the same in dire need of being put to sleep every day due to lack of Rescue and Foster Homes.)

name: Magic
description:
**Please Note: We are only able to adopt within 30-40 miles of the Baltimore, MD area.**

Magic was found in the drainage system under the parking lot at a shopping center. It took several Pet Rescue of Maryland volunteers to trap her and bring her to safety. We believe there was magic in the air for us to successfully rescue her from her predicament. Magic is turning into a sweet and affectionate cat. She loves to hunch up her back against your hand to be petted and she also gives head butts. She's still not too sure she likes to be picked up, but she tolerates it for short periods of time.

**For more information on our adoption policies, please go to www.petrescueofmd.org and click on our Adoption Information and FAQ links.

name: DALTON
description:
Dalton has a sponsor who will pay half ($150.00) of his adoption fee.

Dalton is a big ham and we just can't figure out why he's still with us. This boy is one of the most handsome of the bunch - our pictures just don't do him justice. He is a beautiful chocolate red male who has some of the most stunning physical definition we've ever seen.  We're thinking he might be a good training partner for a Navy SEAL or maybe someone training for an Iron Man competition - we challenge you to keep up with our D-Man!

Dalton is a good boy in his crate and loves car rides and playing fetch. He is definitely a high energy boy who will need to go to an experienced bully home. Did we mention he's got a remarkable vertical leap? Dalton would probably do best paired with a submissive female or as an only dog. As far as people go, he loves everybody - he'll bounce up to your eye level just to show you!  He will greatly benefit from anybody willing to give him the training and extensive exercise that he needs.

Dalton is recommended for a home with children over the age of 12 and will require a fully fenced yard.


**Before meeting any Buster dog an application must be completed.
http://thebusterfoundation.rescuegroups.org/forms/

name: Judith
description:
Please contact Shanna (shanna.rdh@gmail.com) for more information about this pet.

JUDITH came to BullyPaws in 2010.  She was turned into a shelter, where she gave birth to two puppies who were adopted.  We believe that Judith was used for breeding and received very little positive human interaction.  She is very nervous around other dogs and because of this, needs to be the only pet in the home.

Judith :

-          Adores people, enjoys just hanging out in the house and snuggling on the couch

-          Loves going for walks in the neighborhood, walks great on a leash

-          Loves car rides, especially when she can lay in the back seat on her big comfy comforter

-          Eats her food very gently

-          Does great during nail trimmings or when given a bath- she sits still and she loves to get her ears cleaned and groans when you scratch them

-          Very well behaved on outings and when going to the vet

-          Does not like it when her collar gets grabbed

-          Not good with cats or other little furry critters

-          Needs to go out frequently, so would love to have a dog door so she can come and go as she pleases

Judith is a special lady who will need someone with patience and time to get to know her and for her to get to know them.  Her needs are few: A warm comfy bed, good food, a loving, patient family, and daily exercise.  She is an absolutely delightful dog who is looking for her retirement home. She would do really well in a home with someone who has a lot of time for her, maybe a retired couple or person; or someone who works from home. Due to her history we recommend Judith to an adult home only.

-Please come and meet this beautiful soul.

name: Apollo
breed: Australian Cattle Dog/Blue Heeler / Mixed (short coat)
description:
Approx. DOB: 12/1/2007                    Approx. Weight:65

 $100 adoption fee includes a 2 week trial to ensure everyone's happiness!

Apollo was one of a litter of 7 brought to us after being dumped in the country. He was adopted from us and 9 years later was dumped at a shelter. He prefers to be the only dog. Loves to be petted and brushed. He has a very soft coat and kind personality. Apollo likes going for walks and rides in the car. While older, he still plays like a youngster, but calmer than a youngster.

He is well behaved in the home and does well getting baths. Crate trained and housebroken. It would probably be better to be in a house without babies or toddlers due to his age.

He has been neutered, vaccinated, dewormed, microchipped. Fill out a application at www.furrykidsrefuge.org, click on 'Adopt A Dog' and please be patient while our dedicated volunteers get back to you. Thank you for your interest in Apollo!


Furry Kids' Refuge is in need of good quality dog and puppy food with meat as the first ingredient.  You can drop off donations at our weekly adoption events at the Lee's Summit Petco (1860 NW Chipman Road, Lee's Summit, MO), Saturdays only from Noon to 4:00 p.m.  Donations are tax deductible as allowed by law. 

Would you like to foster a Furry Kid? Furry Kids' Refuge will supply the food & vet care while you supply the basic house rules & love.......win-win for all!!  Just visit our website http://www.furrykidsrefuge.org/category/fostering/  for more information. Thanks for your support!

You can drop off donations at our weekly adoption events at the Lee's Summit Petco (1860 NW Chipman Road, Lee's Summit, MO), Saturdays only from Noon to 4:00 p.m. Donations are tax deductible as allowed by law. 

 Would you like to foster a Furry Kid? Furry Kids' Refuge will supply the food & vet care while you supply the basic house rules & love.......win-win for all!! Just visit our website http://www.furrykidsrefuge.org/category/fostering/ for more information. Thanks for your support!

name: Cosmo
description:
Dislikes: noise

Likes: Pokey, other cats

Cosmo is a big, mellow tabby boy who likes his naps in the sun with his buddy Pokey. His back feet look like they've been dipped in white-sugar toes. Cosmo has never met a cat he didn't like. His affection and trust is reserved for quiet people he knows well. But once you have won Cosmo's trust, you are blessed with a cat who can occupy your entire lap and likes tummy rubs.

Interested in adopting this pet? Please click here for more information.  www.wesavepets.com/info/adoption
And then click on the blue " Safe Haven of Iowa County Online Application" link at the bottom.

name: Fostering
description:
Please note: The cats pictured in this ad are no longer available for adoption; this is a general ad for fostering.

If you cannot own your own cat for fear of long-term commitment or if you want to help care for a cat (or kitten) while it waits to find a forever home then fostering may be for you! If you are over 18 years of age, own your own home or have proof of approval from a land lord, and have prior cat experience, please inquire. Yolo County SPCA provides all the expenses, you provide the love. If you are interested, please email our feline coordinator at cats@yolospca.org or visit our website, yolospca.org, for more information. Thank you for helping make a difference in the lives of animals!

name: Max
description:
Laissez-moi être votre petit copain! J'ai toujours vécu à l'intérieur. J'aime bien me faire gratter la tête et recevoir de doux massages, c'est à ces moments-là que je ronronne le plus fort. Si on me donne un peu d'amour, j'en donne des tonnes en retour. J'ai besoin d'une nouvelle maison où je pourrais me détendre et être votre meilleur ami, c'est ce que je fais le mieux! Je suis un très bon chat!

 

Let me be your Little Buddy! I've always lived indoors. I love getting my head scratched and massaged and I talk-purr a lot. if given love, I will give tons back. I need a new home where I can relax and be your buddy cause that's what I do best! I'm such a great kitty!

 

Plus d'infos sur Max

  • Bon avec les chats, mais timide avec les nouvelles rencontres humaines
  • Non dégriffé
  • Stérilisé
  • Couleur : noir
  • Date de naissance approximative : 19-7-2007
  • Particularité : Afin de lui assurer une bonne santé urinaire, Max doit manger de la nourriture S/O

name: Biggs - LOST
description:
Please help us find Biggs. He was adopted in December of 2007 and escaped his back yard on January 13, 2008, in the area of Dulaire and Pinecroft near Four Seasons Mall in Greensboro, North Carolina. He is listed with local shelters and flyers have been posted but sadly there have been no sightings of Biggs at all. We fear he was picked up or taken in by someone without a care that he is missed, loved and very much wanted back. Biggs is microchipped and has both an ID tag and rabies tag on his collar. Makes no sense that someone would find him and not contact us. We are very hopeful that Biggs is okay and that his microchip will get him back to us. Please keep an eye out for him and contact us if you think you know where he is or who may have him. Biggs is a black and white male Siberian with blue eyes. His approximate DOB is May 2006 and he weighs about 46 lbs. He is tall, leggy and very friendly.



Biggs is a goof ball. He's just happy to be around and having fun. He loves to romp and play with his foster siblings, is great with humans but not tested with cats. Biggs is a black and white male Siberian with blue eyes. His approximate DOB is May 2006 and he weighs about 46 lbs. He is tall and leggy...better to run and jump in the back yard.



Biggs is new to our program but so far we know he crates well, does pretty well on leash but does dig some in the back yard. He has marked in his foster home upon arrival but not done so recently. He has not shown much interest in chew toys but will occasionally grab a Nylabone. He has not challenged the fence at his Foster Home, but that fence is hotwired. He is working on sit and other basic commands. He loves to cuddle and snuggle.



Please check back on Biggs as he settled into his foster home and we learn a bit more about him.



All Southern Siberian Rescue foster dogs are microchipped, up to date on shots, spay/neutered and on monthly heartworm preventative. For additional information on Southern Siberian Rescue and Siberian Huskies, please visit www.SouthernSiberian.com. To fill out an application, please visit How to Adopt.

name: Tyson
description:
DOB: 3/29/07

Tyson was one of three boys abandoned at a pet store in the summer of 2007. At the time, they were a few months old and fairly feral. Tyson is the only one to have tamed down enough where he actually enjoys human interaction. He can be a touch shy at first before he learns to trust new people, but once he does he's all purrs and head butts. Brushing him makes him the happiest cat on earth.

He is extremely cat friendly and has grown up in a house with dogs - he doesn't really interact with them but doesn't fear them either.

As he's aged, he's become much more chatty. I suppose it could be senility? He'll just out of nowhere start talking to himself, usually late in the evening or in the morning when it's relatively quiet.

If you are interested in learning more about Tyson or in adopting him, please click here to email his foster dad.


If you are unable to send an email to the foster parent through the link included above, please contact us and let us know what kitty you're interested in.  You may also fill out our adoption questionnaire to speed up the screening process.  Be sure to name the cat in the CAT PREFERENCE field at the beginning of the questionnaire. If the above links aren't live, our contact form and questionnaire are available on our website at www.kittenrescue.org.

For our fees and adoption policies and procedures, please click here.

name: Chico/SANCTUARAY DOG
color: White with Tan, Yellow or Fawn
description:
PLEASE SCROLL ALL THE WAY DOWN FOR ANIMAL  INFORMATION BEFORE E MAILING I will not answer questions in an email that are answered below!
 
FILL OUT APPLICATION at www.oksaveadog.org NOT the one on Petfinder
 
 
FOR MORE INFORMATION OR OUR APPLICATION PLEASE GO TO WWW.OKSAVEADOG.ORG
Please FILL OUT THE APPLICATION no more than 1 day BEFORE YOU CAN VISIT THE DOGS. http://www.oksaveadog.org/adoption/online-application-form/

All  pets are spayed/neutered, come with current rabies certification and tags, are up to date with other vaccinations, microchipped have tested negative for HW and are wormed every 4 weeks while here. 

 

 


THIS BOY IS NOT FOR ADOPTION AND HAS BEEN LIVING IN OUR SANCTUARY PROGRAM FOR YEARS.. MANY ASK WHAT HAPPENS TO DOGS WHO ARE NOT ADOPTED. SINCE WE ARE A TRUE NO KILL THEY JUST LIVE HERE. PROBLEM IS IT TAKES MONEY TO CARE FOR THE DOGS WHO NEVER GET ADOPTED.  PLEASE CONSIDER DONATIONS TO HELP CARE FOR THE UNWANTED. THEY LIVE VERY NICE LIVES HERE. CHICO HAS BEEN WITH US SINCE 2008

Now neutered and up to date on shots this boy had a great home at one time then like Chrissy found himself with someone that simply wanted to make money off him. When she could not sell the pups she gave them all away.
He is now ready to go back to the life he once knew and stay there.
I cannot say I was terribly fond of this guy at first but I took my own advise and gave him some time he has fast become one of my favorites, he is very shy at first but has warmed up beyond my expectations, so he will need someone willing to allow him to settle in. Look how he has relaxed and softened.
He is about 2 yrs old and 10lbs

Sweet sweet boy someone will be very lucky to have.


FIND APPLICATION AT  WWW.OKSAVEADOG.ORG
PLEASE! DO NOT APPLY UNTIL THE DAY BEFORE YOU CAN PICK THE DOG UP!!! or it will likely be adopted before you get here

IF YOU ARE SEEING IT, IT IS AVAILABLE !. My site is updated daily. 

All dogs carry an adoption fee which helps to pay for deworming, flea control, spay/neuter, HW test
vaccinations and to fix any ailments they may have. The fee is usually less than the vet work they have had.

Thank You for considering adoption. To be considered for one of my dogs please go to  oksaveadog.org and complete the application . Once approved and an appointment set, I will send directions
SORRY I DO NOT SHIP DOGS
FOR THE SAFETY AND COMFORT OF MY DOGS I DO REQUIRE ALL DOGS IN THE HOME BE
SPAYED AND NEUTERED!

description:

name: TG-Rosie
description:
Please contact Tonya Griffith (TMSGriffith@aol.com) for more information about this pet.

(9-28-07) Rosie is a gorgeous Chocolate and White colored Staffordshire and wants to be the sole object of your attention.  She was found as a stray with her puppy.  The people that found her in Arlington had to find her another place since she did not get along with their female Rottweiler mix.  It was probably due to being jealous of attention.

Rosie loves to go for rides, give kisses, and settle in your lap.  If you see her teeth, don't be alarmed because she loves to smile.  She also likes to hunt when outside, so she would probably not be good at a home with cats.  She has done well being paired up with a male as a play mate, but not a female dog for some reason.  She was also being obedience trained by the people that found her, and is also micro chipped.

She has too much energy and gets excited to be around small children - she also starts nipping.  She needs a person that can finish obedience training her, give her the space she needs to run off the energy she has, and stay firm with her when she doesn't follow the rules.  She tends to bolt out a house door when opened, so she needs to be trained to stay inside until given permission to go outside.

She has been adopted 3 times so far, but has not found the right environment for her yet.  Each family has loved her very much, but were not able to deal with her energy.  She can chew through a plastic pet carrier, so a black wire crate would probably work better.  She will need to be crated if left alone.

She is very petite in size, so you wouldn't think she is very strong, but she is stronger than she looks when she is being walked on a leash, so a harness is best when she is walked so she doesn't choke herself.

D.O.B.:     ? 2005
Weight:     39.0 - 7/12/07

$25 adoption fee.  Her original adoption fee has already been paid once.

name: TG-Suki
breed: Catahoula Leopard Dog / Labrador Retriever / Mixed (short coat)
description:
Please contact Tonya Griffith (TMSGriffith@aol.com) for more information about this pet.

Suki and her brother Kimp were transferred from the shelter around January 25, 2006, due to them not wanting to euthanize them.  Her brother was adopted, but Suki is still waiting for a home.  Suki can climb small fences, so she needs a 6 foot fence to keep her in.  She is very sweet, crate trained, and runs right to her crate when called, so house training would be very easy.  She had mild hip displasia at an early age.  Her leg bone came out of the socket, and was put back in, but wouldn't stay, so she had to have surgery.  The first surgery developed a staff infection, and the ball joint on the leg bone had to be shaved off.  This was an amazing surgery, because her leg muscles hold her leg up now, and she runs around like she has never had surgery.

D.O.B.:     ? November 2005
Weight:     24.0 - 3/14/06; 41.8 9/12/07
Sibling:      Kimp

$60 adoption fee will pay for her spay and vaccinations.

name: Dante
description:
For more information about Dante or if you would like to meet his in his foster home, please call Molly at 651-295-3758 or submit an online adoption inquiry form.

I am Dante - a gentle, sweet, and dignified older kitty. I am well known to be very affectionate and appreciative of human attentiveness (not at all "clingy" or "needy"). I am calm and restful most of the time, but if a string or cord is wiggled in front of me, I love to trap the end under my paw, pick it up by mouth, and walk away. Soft brushing along my back and tummy is another favorite activity. I love my small, rectangular, rubber face scratcher: I hold it between my two front legs and rub my cheeks against the soft rubbery prongs. Ahhhhh, such a diligent self-soother I am! I like to sit on the window ledge and watch squirrels, birds, and leaves moving about outside. Come meet me in foster care at a time that's convenient for you and see what a nice boy I am. I LOVE being petted and if you are watching TV, reading, or talking with guests, I'll sit near by and enjoy the company. I am very popular with volunteers because of my great personality and handsome demeanor.  Since I have so much love and attention to give to any family who adopts me you won't need another cat!  I love having my human family members all to myself so I must be the only cat in my new family's household.  Don't worry I'll keep you warm in the winters and you won't be without companionship with me around!

I have diabetes that is well regulated and I do very well with one insulin injection a day - the shot is easy to administer. I'm a model cat and don't mind my insulin shots at all.  If you're looking for a wonderful companion, please call Molly at 651-295-3758 or submit an online adoption inquiry form.


For more information about Feline Rescue, Inc. and a complete listing of our available cats, go to the Feline Rescue website. If you'd like to hear more Feline Rescue stories and see more pictures of our cats, check out the Feline Rescue Blog!

name: Gary
breed: Domestic Medium Hair / Russian Blue / Mixed (long coat)
description: Gary is a sweet but shy boy. He would do best in a nice quiet home. He loves to have his head and neck scratched but he is easily startled. But we think once he gets settled in, he will bond with the right family. He loves his mom and sister - Inca and Noelle and he gets along with other cats. If you are interested in adopting Gary, please e-mail jcirwin@pacbell.net to request an application or call (818)707-6186. Our adoption fee is $125.00 per cat which covers the cost of spaying or neutering, testing for feline aids and leukemia, first vaccination, de-worming, Advantage flea treatment., and the care of the animal prior to adoption.

name: Midnight
description:
1/22/2015. Duncan & Midnight are brothers who have been in our foster care and waiting for their forever home for a long time. Both are very sweet, affectionate cats and although they're now approx. 10 years old you would never know since they are quite playful guys.One of their favorites is the lazer light, then anything that dangles that they can swat in the air.

Both boys are neutered, up to date on vaccines, and have tested negative for FIV and FeLV.

Please note :The Cat Shack rescue is all volunteer and the adopted cats are delivered to your home. Because we deliver the cats to you, we must restrict the adoptions of our highly adoptable cats to a 1 hour drive from the Allentown PA area. In certain situations, "special-needs" cats, ferals and older cats will be adopted to homes at a greater distance then a 1 hour drive from Allentown PA.

The first step to adoption is to fill out an on -line application.

Click here to send a HOUSE CAT Adoption Application for this cat.

All cats are vaccinated, dewormed, tested and altered as part of the adoption contract. This basic care (and other vet work required to make our rescues healthy) is included in the $75 adoption donation!

All adopters also get an adoption gift bag with some free samples of cat products and a 4lb bag of Science Diet cat food.

 


Adopting from The Cat Shack

The Cat Shack rescue is all volunteer and the adopted cats are delivered to your home. Because we deliver the cats to you, we must restrict the adoptions of our highly adoptable cats to a 1 hour drive from the Allentown PA area. In certain situations, 'special-needs' cats, ferals and older cats will be adopted to homes at a greater distance then a 1 hour drive from Allentown PA.

The first step in adoption is to...

Fill out an on-line application:

House Cat Application | Barn Cat Application

Young KITTENS are always adopted in Pairs or to homes with other felines already in the home. Click here to read why kittens are happier with a buddy!

All cats are vaccinated, dewormed, tested and altered as part of the adoption contract. This basic care (and other vet work required to make our rescues healthy) is included in the $85 adoption donation!

description:
Room 3
Hi, my name is Honeybee.  Let me tell you my story!  I once had a loving home but my owner passed away and I was brought back to the Olive Branch.  I was very sad for awhile but being around all of the loving staff and the other cats here has helped me get over my grief.  I am now ready to give another family a try.  I am a very gentle, loving kitty.  Won't you think about taking me home with you?  SV

name: Daisy
description: Daisy is a sweet girl with a super soft coat, and she does not shed!  She'll even sleep on your chest or shoulder.  She is truly a beautiful girl with a charming personality.  Daisy is not fond of other cats, but she can live peacefully with them if they are not the type to cower and run away.  She is waiting her that special someone to give her a loving home; keeping her paws crossed.  Daisy knows her name and will come when she's called too.  Please call (561) 784-4792 for more information or to arrange to meet her.  She's currently in foster in the Lantana area.  Her foster dad says she's a real comfort.  She's like a therapy cat!

name: TG-Erika
description:
Please contact Tonya Griffith (TMSGriffith@aol.com) for more information about this pet.

Pictures updated 10/20/14.  In 2008 I had 17 kittens at one time while helping a person who had 13 cats that were not spayed or neutered, and three of them had litters.  Five of the kittens were never adopted.  I didn't have much time to interact with them, so they are skittish of people, but they can be tamed down more in a one on one environment, or can go to a farm environment.  This cat's mother is Kayla, a Siamese mix.

D.O.B.:     ? March 27, 2008
Weight:    

Our adoption contracts prohibit declawing of any kittens or cats, it is cruel, can traumatize the pet, and make the pet defenseless if the pet should get outside.  We encourage people to look for a kitten or cat that has already been declawed and needs a new home.

$50 adoption fee will pay for her spay and vaccinations.

name: Tipper Blue SN
description:
PURRS ABOUND SIAMESE RESCUE OF MICHIGAN,INC.

10/15/16 Tipper Blue is a female spayed blue-point Siamese. She lost the tip of her tail to an aggressive dog but it is not noticeable and causes her no problem. She loves to play with catnip and chasing string type toys. She likes to be pet for short periods of time and will sit in your lap for a little while. She mostly just wants to be in the room with you and keep you company. She is easy to care for and will reach out to touch your leg if you pass her without saying HI. She needs to be the only pet in the household and an adult home only.

Applications are available online at our web site www.purrssiameserescue.org


Please visit our website to learn more about our rescue and our adoption process.

If you can't adopt at this time, will you please consider a donation to Purrs Abound so they can continue to help kitties in desperate need of love and a second chance at life?

 

If you can't donate, but are shopping online, please consider clicking through to iGive. iGive is a secured shopping site portal to over 470 merchants that will donate a portion of your purchase price back to Purrs Abound Siamese Rescue of Michigan, Inc. You pay nothing extra. It's an easy and free way for you to buy what you want, and give the gift of life to less fortunate felines through your purchases. If you are not a member of iGive, just sign up for free and select Purrs as your charity and enjoy your shopping from there!

name: OK Fosters Needed
description:
Fosters and transport volunteers needed for Great Pyrenees dogs.  Work with other local volunteers to save this noble breed.  Dogs may be male or female of any age, owner surrenders or pulls from kill shelters.  Familiarity with the breed or other large breeds a plus! Dogs will be placed as inside pets with outside privileges to a secure above ground fenced area.  Please complete the online volunteer application if you would like to foster. If qualified, we will make arrangements for you to meet the dog. To learn more about fostering please visit our volunteer page and read our fostering FAQs.

If you can't foster or adopt at this time, please consider helping our Neediest Cases .

Love this breed? NGPR now has a Rescue Store where your purchase goes to help our rescue dogs and neediest cases.

name: Julia
description:
Be sure and watch my video at the bottom of the description!) I am a very sweet but, at times, shy kitty cat. I love to sleep in the bed next to you (without exception) every night and snuggle. I feel that I would really, really blossom in a home where there were not so many, many cats as the foster home that I live in right now. I really am a beautiful and funny and playful cat. I like to play "chase" through the house. 

I really love food and treats, as I was homeless and came from a place where I did not get very much food and was starving. As shy as I am, I am one of my foster mom's favorite cats.

I really, really miss my 17-year-old buddy, Danny, who had to be euthanized in the summer of 2009 due to an age-related illness.  I immediately connected with him when I first came into my foster mom's household and followed him wherever he went.  I felt that he protected me and took care of me.  I'd love to have another buddy just like Danny.

Contact Mary Kay at 713-453-8621.


Julia

Adoption info: Julia's estimaed DOB is 6-05. Her adoption fee is $65. She has been spayed, combo test negative for feline leukemia and FIV, all shots and dewormed and will be microchipped at the time of adoption.

name: Barn Cats
description:
We currently have a number of male and female cats adult kitties who are not adapting well to being with people in a home setting. However, they would be great as Barn Cats where they can still interact with people but aren't confined to a house. All barn cats are fully vetted.


For more information or to adopt, please use the preferred method of communication which is email at citcrescue@yahoo.com. Emails are answered within 24 hours.

name: Loopy
description:
I'm still working on my interpersonal skills. I have a history of abandonment, hungar and fear. I was all alone for a time and had to defend myself from other animals and spend most of me day trying to find food. Now that I have a place to stay and good food to eat, I can work on trust, friendship and love. I am enjoying the attention and petting and kind words. I also am looking forward to having my first ever home. Thanks to all of you who care about and for us orphans.


For more information or to adopt, please use the preferred method of communication which is email at citcrescue@yahoo.com. Emails are answered within 24 hours.

name: Helena
description:
(Be sure and watch my video at the bottom of the description!) My name is Helena. I am a very special kitty cat. I was trapped outside of an elderly woman's house that has many, many cats, and my care taker, Mary Kay, is helping Helen, the elderly woman, get Helen's cats adopted and spayed and neutered.

I am absolutely not a feral cat, but I was living outside, obviously abandoned by an uncaring owner. Therefore I am very shy. But I, oh, so love for Mary Kay to rub me and pet me.

Won't you kitty lovers consider adopting me? I could get along with another kitty cat, but I need that special person that has time to spend with me to bring out the wonderful, loving personality that is hiding behind some fears that were thrust upon me by being abandoned when all I wanted was someone to love me and take care of me.

I am a little skittish, but I do not run from my caretaker. I always welcome a rub on the back and a scratch and always arch my body in appreciation when my caretaker pets me.

Please show me what it's like to live "Somewhere Over the Rainbow."

Contact Mary Kay at 713-453-8621.

name: CaliMary
breed: Calico / Domestic Short Hair / Mixed (short coat)
description:
Please contact Chris (chrisncats@gmail.com) for more information about this pet.



 


Hi there! My name is CaliMary and I am a very sweet girl! I was trapped and "fixed" in May 2008 and decided it was much better to be an indoor cat than an outdoor cat. Now the food comes to me and I don't have to go hunt for it! I am current on my vaccinations and know how to use a litterbox. My foster dad thinks I was about one year old when rescued in May of 2008. I have slowed down a bit in my senior years but still have my Calico Cattitude! Won't you please give me a forever home? I will purr a lot and love you 'til the end of time. Meow!!

If you are interested in adopting CaliMary, please contact Chris at 210-232-2790. Sorry, we do not ship our cats, provide any transportation, or do out of state adoptions.

name: Chole G
breed: Domestic Short Hair / Tabby / Mixed (short coat)
description:
OUTSIDE

EST. D.O.B: 05/13/2007

More about me:Chloe G is a wonderful cat.  She loves the outside.  She gets along well with other cats and dogs.  She is very friendly. She has been at the Olive Branch a very long time. She loves to prowl around checking all the animals out and will "help" you with your chores.   Chloe G is spayed, feline leukemia negative, and her shots are current. 

Chloe G has been in the house and is litter trained.  She could make a great farm cat where she could also have  access to the inside.

Won't you please consider giving Chloe G a forever home so that she can feel a family's love?

If you’re interested in Chloe G go to www.olivebranchwv.org and fill out an online application. Someone will get back to you ASAP. You can visit her, or call 304-652-1010 for more information.

name: 1 X 1 cats
description:
See the cats available through our "buddy shelter" 1 by 1 in Kutztown!
www.1by1.petfinder.org

Adopting from The Cat Shack

The Cat Shack rescue is all volunteer and the adopted cats are delivered to your home. Because we deliver the cats to you, we must restrict the adoptions of our highly adoptable cats to a 1 hour drive from the Allentown PA area. In certain situations, 'special-needs' cats, ferals and older cats will be adopted to homes at a greater distance then a 1 hour drive from Allentown PA.

The first step in adoption is to...

Fill out an on-line application:

House Cat Application | Barn Cat Application

Young KITTENS are always adopted in Pairs or to homes with other felines already in the home. Click here to read why kittens are happier with a buddy!

All cats are vaccinated, dewormed, tested and altered as part of the adoption contract. This basic care (and other vet work required to make our rescues healthy) is included in the $85 adoption donation!

name: FOSTER HOMES Neede
description:
The Cat Shack, Inc. is in dire need of foster homes. We are currently overcapacity and need more foster homes.

What is involved with fostering?

We provide any veterinary expenses that may occur, Science Diet Dry Cat food for the cat or kitten and you provide lots of love and attention.

Each day so many cats and kittens are euthanized or left to fend for themselves outside. We get dozens of calls each week asking if we can help with stray cats and kittens so there are many more out there that need to be saved. We would like to help more of these poor kitties out there but need your help.

How do our cats get adopted?

We have adoption days at the local PetSmart in Whitehall on various Saturdays throughout the month. We also have our adoption center at this PetSmart which houses anywhere from 4- 9 cats at a time. Foster homes are required to bring the cats or kittens to adoption days if their schedule permits. We also have other special events to promote adoptions.

If you want to foster a specific cat or kitten or if you have a preference as to what you'd like to foster, we can help you find the right foster kitty. Without your help, we won't be able to help the many kitties out there that need our help!

If you are interested in fostering, please fill out an online application to adopt or call us at 610-967-9097, option 3. When filling out the application list under the cat name that you would like to foster.

We do screen our adopters and do a home visit to make sure our cats and kittens are getting the very best home they deserve. So you have peace of mind knowing they will be going to a great home!

There is nothing more rewarding then seeing your foster cat or kitten get adopted!


Adopting from The Cat Shack

The Cat Shack rescue is all volunteer and the adopted cats are delivered to your home. Because we deliver the cats to you, we must restrict the adoptions of our highly adoptable cats to a 1 hour drive from the Allentown PA area. In certain situations, 'special-needs' cats, ferals and older cats will be adopted to homes at a greater distance then a 1 hour drive from Allentown PA.

The first step in adoption is to...

Fill out an on-line application:

House Cat Application | Barn Cat Application

Young KITTENS are always adopted in Pairs or to homes with other felines already in the home. Click here to read why kittens are happier with a buddy!

All cats are vaccinated, dewormed, tested and altered as part of the adoption contract. This basic care (and other vet work required to make our rescues healthy) is included in the $85 adoption donation!

name: Angel
description:
Angel is a very sweet 11 yr. old female American Staffordshire Terrier. She is spayed, microchipped, and current on vaccinations. She weighs 61 lbs. and wants to be a lap dog. She is crate trained, house trained and knows sit, down, stay, and her left and right. She loves people, children and most other dogs; however, she is selective about which doggy friends she plays with. When she wants something, or wants to go out, she sings. She has a very good voice. She was abandoned by her irresponsible owner with her 10 one-week old puppies. Her pups have been adopted, but not her. She desperately wants her "forever" home. Angel needs a family who is experienced with this breed and will give her the love and patience she deserves.

If you have room in your heart and  home, please contact Dallas or Esther at 757-583-8777 or e-mail rainbowanimalrescue@cox.net.

name: Chance
description:
Please contact Janice (janice.frazier@sbcglobal.net) for more information about this pet.

Online Adoption Application ›



Koko (originally Chance) is a beautiful adult male blue point Siamese cat with a lot of love to give, but he needs to know you to open up.  He was originally adopted by a couple who have both now passed away.  He has always been an indoor cat and he is, like most Siameses, a totally bonded to his caregiver cat, so he’s just longing for another owner, in a quiet home.  He enjoys being brushed and petted and enjoys treats.  He also enjoys playing with his wiffle golf balls, and fake mouse toy but is not a crazy active cat.  Though he will occasionally speak up, like Siamese crosses will do, he is a quiet guy, just like he was as a baby!   He will be a great companion cat for the person who understands him!  We are showing him in the foster home versus fairs so contact us to schedule a meeting!

This is his orginal info since rescued as a youngster: Chance is a handsome blue point Siamese mix boy, with nice blue eyes, who is very lucky to be rescued.  He was born on a busy downtown San Jose street, where he could have easily been hit by a car, and was out there taking his “chances”.  He is playful and also a bit talkative, but not as talkative as some Siamese are.
He can be adopted solo, though he gets along with other kitties and gentle dogs, so is fine with them too.  He currently does not have experience with children.


How To Adopt Me!

13thstcats.org is a 501(c)(3) Non-Profit, No-Kill Rescue Group based in San Jose.

We try our best to match our cats to the perfect homes, and match them based on their personalities, not their looks. Adoptions are not done on a first come, first serve basis, rather in the order of what homes are the right match for that particular cat

Please contact Janice (janice.frazier@sbcglobal.net) for more information about this pet.


 Online Adoption Application ›

 



Koko (originally Chance) is a beautiful adult male blue point Siamese cat with a lot of love to give, but he needs to know you to open up. He was originally adopted by a couple who have both now passed away. He has always been an indoor cat and he is, like most Siameses, a totally bonded to his caregiver cat, so he’s just longing for another owner, in a quiet home. He enjoys being brushed and petted and enjoys treats. He also enjoys playing with his wiffle golf balls, and fake mouse toy but is not a crazy active cat. Though he will occasionally speak up, like Siamese crosses will do, he is a quiet guy, just like he was as a baby!  He will be a great companion cat for the person who understands him! We are showing him in the foster home versus fairs so contact us to schedule a meeting!

 This is his orginal info since rescued as a youngster: Chance is a handsome blue point Siamese mix boy, with nice blue eyes, who is very lucky to be rescued. He was born on a busy downtown San Jose street, where he could have easily been hit by a car, and was out there taking his “chances”. He is playful and also a bit talkative, but not as talkative as some Siamese are.
 He can be adopted solo, though he gets along with other kitties and gentle dogs, so is fine with them too. He currently does not have experience with children.






 How To Adopt Me!  13thstcats.org is a 501(c)(3) Non-Profit, No-Kill Rescue Group based in San Jose. 

 We try our best to match our cats to the perfect homes, and match them based on their personalities, not their looks. Adoptions are not done on a first come, first serve basis, rather in the order of what homes are the right match for that particular cat

name: Sabina
summary: See A Current List of Our Kitties; www:animalnetwork.org We Specialize In “Pet-Quality”, Friendly, Sociable Cats and Kittens that live in private homes with people that love them.
description:
Our Animals Live In Private Homes With People That Love Them. We Specialize In “Pet-Quality”, Friendly, Sociable Cats and Kittens and Represent “Good Samaritans” In Re-homing Lost Pets Whose Owner Could Not Be Found and Private Parties Whose Dogs Need New Homes.

Please See www.animalnetwork.org for more information, or call 949-759-3646.

Our Network Promotes Adopting Cats/Kittens in Pairs and Make Available a Four Month Payment Plan When Adopting Pairs. Please Ask for our Handout About Why Adopting Pairs of Cats is Best.


See A Current List of Our Kitties; www:animalnetwork.org We Specialize In “Pet-Quality”, Friendly, Sociable Cats and Kittens that live in private homes with people that love them.

Visit our website at: www.animalnetwork.org to see our fees, adoption requirements and to view other available animals we have for adoption. Email: contact@animalnetwork.org for the application to adopt and tell us a little about your family’s lifestyle and home. Some of the new arrivals can be seen in the caregiver’s homes on weekdays. A mandatory pet parenting class is given on Saturdays so you can learn how to introduce your new pet to existing ones, teaching house manners, recommended foods and the best litter, and what you can do to avoid your cat from getting certain diseases. If you can’t find the pet that you are looking for sign up for our “Pet Match Service” and tell us what you are looking for. A $25 donation is accepted for this 1 year service.


The founder of Animal Network of Orange County, DiAnna Pfaff-Martin, is very particular about the quality of the animals, vitamins, proper diet and veterinary medical care. Feral kittens are tamed to “pet quality” and rescue cats that are shy are disclosed and termed, “rescue quality” with a lower placement fee. Pfaff-Martin teaches a one hour “feline pet-parenting” class to all that adopt to ensure that network animals have the proper care for their lifetime. The AVID microchip registration is included in the placement fee and the animals come with a 30 day heath commitment and return policy.

Most kittens in O.C. these days are born feral (wild without human touch since birth). Feral kittens left untamed can grow up and be skittish and hide. These kitties can be a challenge to get to the vet or even touch other than their caregiver. People whom have adopted feral kittens often describe their behavior as having been abused.

It’s what the organization does with the animals after they have been trapped and rescued from the outdoors that makes the difference in a quality animal. People believe that adopting the smallest kitten means they can raise the perfect animal. This is simply not true as most people are gone from the home for long hours and are not experts in the field of taming wild animals.

Adopting an adult animal that has been well-loved and has known behaviors and a personality that the caregiver can tell you about is what all should consider. Almost anyone would add a cute kitten into their home. 90% of adult cats entering the municipal shelter systems are put to death. Even kittens over 4 months old because people are seeking the tiny ones.
