name: MARIGOLD
description:
DOB 3/2004.

Marigold is not available for adoption. She would make an ideal candidate for our Guardian Angel Program.

This pretty flame tabby was left in a box at the door, with two moms and 10 other kittens. She is the only one who hasn't found a forever home, maybe because she wants that to be DKC.

She is a spirited girl and will not be put in a carrier or cage without a battle, so you will not see her at LuvAPet. She wants to stay on her home turf. Come visit her at the shelter. 
Marigold would like to have a guardian angel.


For all pet inquiries and for faster service, please contact the Adoption Director by email at adoptions@dognkittycity.org. If you need to speak with someone, you can call the shelter and leave a message at 214-350-7387. If you are interested in adopting this pet you will need to submit a filled-in adoption application (dognkittycity.org/2/adoption-application.html) to the Adoption Director in person, by email, or by fax at 214-484-6695.

Adoption Director
Email: adoptions@dognkittycity.org
Fax:     214-484-6695		 Dog & Kitty City
dognkittycity.org
2719 Manor Way
Dallas, Texas 75235

Phone: 214-350-7387
Hours: Daily 11:45-5. Closed holidays.

Please note that many of our dogs are at off-site adopt-a-pets on Saturdays, and some of our pets are in foster homes or other off-site adoption locations, such as PetSmart. Please email us to verify that the pet you are interested in is at the shelter prior to visiting us. GREATER DALLAS INQUIRIES ONLY, PLEASE!

If you are interested to help us continue to provide assistance for homeless pets, please make a donation.

name: Foster homes needed
description:
All dogs are altered, up to date on vaccinations, heartworm tested/started on prevention prior to being adopted
  PLEASE SEND ALL INQUIRES TO WSADOPTIONS@WOLFSPIRITSRESCUE.COM SO THAT WE ARE SURE WE RECEIVE THEM.
To fill out an adoption application for this dog please visit www.WolfSpiritsRescue.com
 

We currently need foster homes for small, medium and large breeds.   Yes, we are expanding since there are so many dogs that need a home.

Help us help them to safety.


So many have a sad story and just need a little love and attention to help them blossom into happy/trusting companions.   Won't you help them by providing a temporary home for them?  Thinking of adoption but not sure ?  What a great way to see if a particular dog is the right fit for you too.

The more foster homes we have the more we can all save together. Some need fenced yards while others don't.  Some are not good with young children.  We will let our foster homes know everything we know about each particular dog prior to them fostering them. 

All dogs are isolated for a minimum of two weeks so that our foster homes' own pets are not in danger of catching something contagious  ( kennel cough, etc )  They are completely vetted prior to coming to your home. We provide heartworm prevention for each foster dog as well as all vet expenses.

 All we ask is that our foster homes provide lots of love, patience, understanding, a premimum quality food, and a crate for training.  Foster homes will also provide monthly updates including pictures to be posted on our web site. 

Please email for more details if you are interested in fostering. Or call Robin @ 234-571-9014
 Or click on the link below to fill out our foster application and one of our volunteers will be in contact with you.

http://www.wolfspiritsrescue.com/forms/

name: Gidget
description:
Dislikes: cats who are not Ziggy (her roommate), being petted

Likes: Ziggy, sunshine, birds

Gidget is a sweet, quiet, cat.    She likes attention from time to time but mostly keeps to herself except  when she joins other roommates in a pile of kitty bodies to snuggle warmly.  She loves to lay in the sun and sun bathe.

Gidget is a short-haired, bicolor white and tabby cat with an attractive stripe down her nose. She tends to bully cats who are not Ziggy. She will allow approximately two pets before she gives a vocal warning to not pet her anymore. It is best to heed that warning as she tends to smack anyone who does not pay attention to it. Her favorite activity is to sit in the sun with Ziggy and watch birds.

Interestingly, this haven that Gidget and Ziggy occupy is the best one for bringing dogs to see how they react to cats.   Some cats will go right for the dog's nose with claws out when you enter their haven with a canine visitor. 


Interested in adopting this pet? Please click here for more information.  www.wesavepets.com/info/adoption
And then click on the blue " Safe Haven of Iowa County Online Application" link at the bottom. 

 

Adoption Info e-mail this page

name: Got Milk
description:
Please contact Marijon Binder (marijonbinder@yahoo.com) for more information about this pet.

Hi, my name is Got Milk. You may be wondering how I got such a unique name. Well, I am a very unique cat. I have a little white 'milk' mustache on my upper mouth. It's very different and I love it. I'm a very cool cat. I'm very laid-back, but I like to play...on my time, of course. Are you looking for a laid-back but playful cat who's as good looking and interesting as me?

To offer me a loving home, please call the nice people at Touched By An Animal/Cats-Are-Purrsons-Too at (773)728-6336 or e-mail them at TBA@touchedbyananimal.org.

name: Cessper Long haired
color: Black with Brown, Red, Golden, Orange or Chestnut
description:
Update:  Cessper plays well with others for the most part, but can be "bossy" (have to act tough when you are little!), and he likes to bark at the cats but I doubt he would ever hurt anyone – he is very sweet natured. He is between 18 and 20lbs and could stand a little diet with a pound (or five) loss, lol! He has medium length hair that is pretty easy to keep nice. He has a large yard that he loves to run and play in, but has not had any leash training. I have found that the little ones usually adapt to that and learn very quickly with a harness. He recently tore an ACL and is still healing from that (another reason the weight loss would be a good idea). I have him on natural supplements to help alleviate inflammation and prevent arthritis.

 

Update from Foster MOM:  Cesspar, is social and will play, play, play with anyone who will play with him. He gets excited with new things, and will do a little dance when he is happy and seeing something new and exciting.  Just a happy, happy little guy!!!

Update:  Cessper is now looking at reaching his fourth birthday, spending now his entire puppy hood and entering into adult hood in foster care.  Cute little guy, happy, playful and uses a doggy door.........we dont want to see him grow any older in foster care, please consider this darling boy, he would make a great best buddy for other little ones but loves to be with dogs of all sizes that are just nice buddies.  He has grown to a plump and chubby 15 lbs of darling to love!

 

Update:  Cessper remains a little boy, he is somewhat of a cautions boy but is sweet and playful and likes to hold onto my finger to "help" me when I'm doing chores. This boy would be a perfect pet and playmate to another little one!!

 

Original post:  Cessper was born June 10, 2008, he is a gentle and loving little guy who needs a home of his own! He has a over bite which is adorable!! Adoption fee $150

name: Amy
description:
Please contact Foster for more information about this pet.

My name is Amy and I would love to be your snuggle buddy.

 

Here are some very important things you need to know about me

 

Approximate age/birthdate:  February 2008 ... she's a sweet senior girl

Weight/size: 50 lbs

Housebroken:  90%

 

Crate trained:  YES

Personality:  happy, loving, playful, wants to make you happy

 

Energy level:  medium (except when she's snuggling)

Fenced yard required?:   YES

Does he/she jump fences?  YES – she does well on a zip line for a reasonable/short period of time or in a kennel with a solid roof on it (not an A-frame tarp roof)

 

Leash walk:  YES – very strong and still pulls but will improve if walked consistently

Obedience training:  Knows ‘sit’ and ‘off’ – very smart, will train easily with consistent effort

Riding in vehicles:  RIDES OK      

Spayed/neutered:   YES

Up-to-date on routine vaccinations:   YES

Microchipped:   NO (microchip can be provided)

Social with other dogs:  YES - she is a submissive personality and is sometimes bullied by stronger personalities 

Social with cats:  NO CATS

Good with children:  She will be fine with older, respectful children. 

 

Adoption fee:  $75

 

Amy is the cutest little clown - a mix of terrier and something that has BIG ears.  She is 50 pounds of wiggles, love and snuggles.  She is too cute – very loving, very playful and good with other dogs when introduced properly.   

Amy is aging gracefully, but just like us, she has a little arthritis and sometimes has a little limp.  She can still run like the wind and jump fences at will.  She still has plenty of playful energy, but she really loves to get in your lap!  Her coat is beautiful - she looks like a yellow/tan tiger. She walks on leash, but needs more practice to stop her urge to pull!

Amy is crate-trained and about 90% housebroken, spayed and up-to-date on her shots. She still thinks she's a youngster and she can also jump/climb a 6 foot fence or kennel area so she needs to be an inside dog with a zip line for short stays outside or she will need to be trained to an underground fence.  She will do well with a forever family that will take on her on walks and spend time playing with her. She is so sweet and adorable, spending time with her is easy to do!

If you think Amy might be the perfect pup for you, please go to www.allamericanmuttrescue.org, click on Forms/Application and complete your adoption application online.

We are an all-volunteer group, so please be patient and understand that it takes an average of 7-14 days to process the applications including reference checks, follow-up questions and home visits.  You can expedite the process by providing accurate email addresses for all your references.  Time to make phone calls is limited and we often have 10 or more applications in process.  We make every effort to move through them as quickly as possible.

 

When your application is approved, we will schedule a meet-and-greet to see if Amy picks you too.

If it seems that the adoption will be a good match for all, there is an adoption fee, and an adoption contract to be signed.

Please feel free to email weluvpups@hotmail.com if you have additional questions.

name: ZuZu
description:
Please contact Cindy for more information about this pet.

I am ZuZu and I am a super mutt.  I have lots of love to give.  Will you give me a chance?

 

Here are some very important things you need to know about me

 

Approximate age/birthdate:  March 17, 2008

Weight/size: 60 lbs

Housebroken:  YES ... as long as you do your part and get her outside 4-5 times/day

Crate trained:  YES – does NOT like staying in a crate and protests

Personality: alpha female, playful, loving, bossy, territorial, stubborn

 

Energy level:  medium with bursts of high

Fenced yard required?:   YES – the husky in her makes her a ‘runner’.  Must be a physical fence - no exceptions

 

Does he/she jump fences?  NO – she could, but if she is happy she doesn’t

 

Leash walk:  YES but still pulls – with more practice, she would be fine

Obedience training:  Knows ‘sit’ and ‘off’ – smart and could train easily with proper motivation.  She is very smart, but stubborn


Riding in vehicles:  RIDES OK but is not her favorite thing to do.     

Spayed/neutered:   YES

Up-to-date on routine vaccinations:   YES

Microchipped:   NO

Social with other dogs:  If properly introduced she will do fine.  She is very alpha when meeting new dogs and needs to be supervised.  Not good with much smaller dogs.

Social with cats:  NO CATS – true to her breed mixes, she has a high prey drive and could be a danger to smaller animals including smaller dogs

Good with children:  She will be fine with older, respectful children.  Her size and energy and her territorial nature will be overwhelming for small/young children

 

Adoption fee:  $75

 

ZuZu is a wonderful mutt girl – mom is a spaniel/lab and dad is a husky/malamute. ZuZu is a generally an energetic, playful girl who gets along with everybody – but she must be properly introduced to new dogs in order to accept them as part of her pack. She enjoys the company of other dogs and but might be even happier as an only dog as long as her family keeps her socialized with other dogs.  She is an alpha female and she really wants to be the boss … but she wants to have friends.  Her social skills just aren’t always the best.   ZuZu is not a good choice for first time dog owners.  She needs a strong pack leader with big dog experience and one who will work with her consistently to curb her energetic assertiveness. 

ZuZu was crate-trained and housebroken early in life and was leash-walked daily. Due to some changes in her life, she grew to dislike the crate.  She has nice house manners, but she really loves to play outside so having a fenced yard is very important to her.  When she is bored she will find things to amuse herself, so she needs to have a family that will include her in their activities and keep her challenged.  When she has finally played out, you will find her napping in a sunny spot.

If you think ZuZu might be the perfect pup for you, please go to www.allamericanmuttrescue.org, click on Forms/Application and complete your adoption application online.

We are an all-volunteer group, so please be patient and understand that it takes an average of 7-14 days to process the applications including reference checks, follow-up questions and home visits.  You can expedite the process by providing accurate email addresses for all your references.  Time to make phone calls is limited and we often have 10 or more applications in process.  We make every effort to move through them as quickly as possible.

 

When your application is approved, we will schedule a meet-and-greet to see if ZuZu picks you too.

If it seems that the adoption will be a good match for all, there is an adoption fee, and an adoption contract to be signed.

Please feel free to email weluvpups@hotmail.com if you have additional questions.

name: Rocket
description:
Approx DOB:  6/24/2008       Approx Weight:  50 lbs.

 

I'M PART OF A SPECIAL ADOPTION PROMOTION SO

 MY ADOPTION FEE HAS BEEN REDUCED TO $100 

 $150 adoption fee includes a 2 week trial to ensure everyone's happiness. 

Rocket was adopted from Furry Kids as a puppy and returned because he kept escaping his family's yard by jumping their fence.  We have also learned that Rocket is not good with cats.   When he was returned, his nails were extremely long and they are being cut back gradually to allow the quick to recede.  Shortly after he was returned, we also discovered that he was heartworm positive.  He has been treated for the heartworms and if kept on prevention should have no ill effects from them.   

Rocket does well with most dogs, but will stand up for himself if another dog tries to dominate him.  He is crate trained, he is housetrained. Rocket loves people and wants to please you in any way he can. 

Rocket has been neutered, treated for heartworms, is current on vaccinations and is microchipped. If you are interested in adopting Rocket, please fill out the adoption application located at www.furrykidsreufge.org/adoptadog and a dedicated volunteer will get back with you as soon as possible.  Thanks for your interest in Rocket.


Furry Kids' Refuge is in need of good quality dog and puppy food with meat as the first ingredient.  You can drop off donations at our weekly adoption events at the Lee's Summit Petco (1860 NW Chipman Road, Lee's Summit, MO), Saturdays only from Noon to 4:00 p.m.  Donations are tax deductible as allowed by law. 

Would you like to foster a Furry Kid? Furry Kids' Refuge will supply the food & vet care while you supply the basic house rules & love.......win-win for all!!  Just visit our website http://www.furrykidsrefuge.org/category/fostering/  for more information. Thanks for your support!

description: Sweet little Satina is still waiting and wishing for a home of her own.  She has been searching for some time now and wonders if anyone will ever pick her as their new forever friend. Come meet her soon Kiki's room.

name: Amanda
breed: Maine Coon / Domestic Long Hair / Mixed (long coat)
description:
What to say about Amanda......we believe that Amanda has basically been to hell and back. She was obviously abused and/or tormented. She is constantly trying to defend herself and protect her "stuff". When she calms down, she loves affection but is constantly scared that you will begin tormenting her if she lets her guard down, so she doesn't. Amanda came to us with a bad open wound around her rear end and lashing out in terror. The volunteers just love her and are determined to make sure that she gets the patience and tolerance that she needs why we help her to work through her past. She needs a special person/family (no children) that will continue to help her. We realize that this type of special person may not exist outside of the shelter, but we are hoping, for her sake, we are hoping......
Amanda, girl, born 2004 or 05
 
HELP Humane  is a non-profit TRUE No Kill animal shelter currently run on individual donations and fundraising alone. (just south of Kansas City). All HELP animals are treated by veterinarians, receive age appropriate vaccinations, dewormed, spayed/neutered and those incoming after Oct 2005, have been micro chipped. Cats have been FeLqV/FIV tested and are negative unless otherwise stated. Dogs have been heartworm tested and are on heartworm preventative. We have been told by many adopters that the reason they liked adopting from us is because we have a happy place and all the cats are the friendliest ones they had ever met. HELP Humane believes that all life is precious and is therefore, a TRUE No Kill shelter. We have many FIV and FeLV+ cats in our care. They will live with us until they end their life’s journey or find a permanent home. Come Visit Us! Our hours of operation are Tuesday - Friday, 1pm - 8pm , Saturday 10am - 6pm , Sunday 12pm - 5pm , closed on Monday . 511 Main St. Belton, MO 64012 816-318-HELP www.helppets.org Adoption fees vary according to the needs of the animal up for adoption

name: Caviar
breed: Domestic Long Hair / Maine Coon / Mixed (long coat)
description:
Such a sweet little girl this is, however, she can be a little apprehensive with people. The way to win her over is to offer people food. Poor Caviar came from a bad situation where the people didnt have enough money to care for all their cats, so the cats had to scavenge for food, we believe that they were fed leftover table scraps because she is obsessed with people food. So, if this is something that would bother you, best to not choose this girl. With understanding and reassurance, she will understand that she doesnt need to scavenge anymore.......Caviar, girl, born approx 5/06.

name: Sunni
breed: Russian Blue / Domestic Short Hair (short coat)
description: Sunni is a gorgeous Russian Blue........when he was a tiny baby, he had horrible bloated stomach problems. It was determined that he had Mega Colon. After an extensive surgery to fix it, he actually had problems with the stool leaking. That is much better now but the vet just doesnt know a long term prognosis on a cat this young with this type of surgery.....its usually done on older cats. Sunni is AWESOME with other cats, he shows the newbies around and makes them feel comfortable. He loves people and affection. We hope he finds his special family! Sunni, boy, born approx 2005

breed: Tuxedo / Domestic Short Hair / Mixed (short coat)
description:
Little Ms Trina has not had an easy time in life, apparently someone abused her and she is on her guard because of it. She needs someone to give her some time and patience to trust but we think she is worth it. She lives with the fear that someone is going to take her belongings and she realizes that she needs them, so she is protective. She is quite the talker and rather loud also :-) Wont you give her a chance, after all, we all need second chances at something, dont we? Trina has allergies that are controlled with injections and diet. HELP will provide these for Trina's lifetime if you will give her a home :-) Trina, girl, tuxie, born approx 2005

name: Wazoo
description:
DOB appx 8/15/08. DSH brown mackeral tabby, neutered male. This is a cutie patootie, and super friendly.  

 

Wazoo is full grown & about 12 pounds. He LOVES attention and canned food too :)


Back in 2008 Wazoo tested negative for Feline Leukemia. In 2009, Wazoo was re-tested for Feline Leukemia. Despite his sister testing negative, he tested positive and was housed afterward with only Feline Leukemia kitties. 

We recently found out (yes in 2014, 5 years later) that some tests can give positives that were false. We re-tested Wazoo and he is negative. We even sent out an IFA test to the lab to check at the cellular level and we also called the Feline Leukemia testing expert at IDEXX (they are the people who make the tests). She suggested one more test, a PCR, and that is to ensure he is not a "carrier" - that was also negative.  She is the top contact for Feline Leukemia testing, we were referred to her by UF Veterinary School.

Wazoo has come out a winner in this one and is playing in the foster room with the other kitties.

Now let's hit him a home run and get him a forever home!!

Contact Mona at meowmail1@gmail.com.

name: Chandler
description:
*Chandler will do best in a home as the only pet.

Chandler is a victim of the bad economy.  His home was lost to foreclosure, his family forced to move, and instead of taking him with them, they left him locked inside, with a small amount of food and water.  After several days of hearing his cries for help, neighbors broke in to the house, to save Chandler, and give him food and water.

Afterwards, they continued to feed him, however, his life was delegated to a yard that he continuously got out of; probably looking for his family that abandoned him.  After several days of research, his previous family was located, and gave us permission to place Chandler in our rescue program.

As you can see from the photos, Chandler didn't have a great life, even when his family was with him.  He was constantly tied up outside, left for days at a time, and his coat and skin suffered for it.  The tether he was attached to, tightened around his neck, wearing down the hair and causing a rash and skin burns.  These photos were taken after his matted, filthy coat was shaved off.  There was no other way to properly groom him.

Interestingly, after we rescued this wonderful Scottie, all of his fears went away, and he has become a true Scot!  No more worries about where his next meal will come from and no concerns for fresh water.  His medical needs have now been met, and he is ready to find his new home.

Feeding Chandler a high quality food helped his coat immensely, however, it may never completely return.  Nevertheless, Chandler adores attention and being held and petted.  So much so, he has some jealousy issues with other dogs.  Come visit this wonderful Scottie boy, and consider giving him a life-long home that he can call his own!  Chandler is approximately 10yo.

All dogs adopted by Scottie Kingdom Rescue, Inc. have had a full medical exam by one of our licensed Veterinarians, which includes testing (and treatment, if necessary) for Heartworm disease, Lyme disease, Ehrlichia and Anaplasmosis, all necessary vaccinations, spay/neuter surgery, dental cleaning as necessary, microchipping, registration of the microchip, and any other medical needs each particular dog may need. Copies of all available medical records are transferred to you when the adoption is finalized.


We prefer to adopt to families with past Scottie, Westie, Terrier (or similar) experience, but realize this isn’t always possible. We do not ship our pets. If you have that special place in your heart, and in your home, for a Scottie (or any of our other available rescue dogs), please visit us in Dallas for an in person meet & greet session with our available dogs.  If you have existing dogs, they must travel to Dallas with you, so we can be assured that they will be compatible with the new addition to your family.

Please contact us at Rescue@scottiekingdom.com  to receive an Adoption Application or for more information on our Adoption process.  Also, please take the time to visit our website www.scottiekingdom.com for additional information.

We sometimes receive several applications on the same dog. Our goal is to place the dog in the best home possible, based on his/her needs, personality and past history. Please note:  Adoptions are not done on a first come, first served basis.  Submitting an application does not guarantee the adoption of any dog.   We are looking for the best available home for each of our rescue dogs.

Thank you for your understanding, and for considering adoption!

Donations may be made via PayPal to email address:
Donate@scottiekingdom.com
or via USPS, to PO Box 551265 ~ Dallas, TX  75355

Chip
color: White with Red, Golden, Orange or Chestnut
description: Meet Chip! He's an 8 1/2 year old English Setter/Spaniel mix, around 46 lbs. He’s such a sweetheart, very loving and easy to take care of. Most of all, he likes being with people and loves to be in the same room with you.  Chip is great in the house and a non-chewer. He loves his toys and loves lounging around on his dog bed. He enjoys having a fenced yard in his foster home where he can explore around in, but will quickly come in when he's ready. He does not like staying outside alone. His fence must be at least 5 ft tall, preferably a wood fence. Chip's biggest need is to be the only pet.  He lives with other dogs in his foster home, but he gets very attached to people and doesn't want to share the attention. He gets very attached to his person and wants all the attention to himself. We prefer to adopt Chip to someone more settled, preferably late 40's and older...someone who has the time to spend with him. Young adults just starting out won't be the right match for him. Chip is also housebroken, neutered and current on all shots and ready for his new home.

name: Jack
description:
Please contact Dusti (poochheavenvolunteer@gmail.com) for more information about this pet.

Smart, happy, loving, very handsome... What more could you want in a dog?! Meet Jack, he is a 13 year old Bulldog and weighs 94.5lbs. Jack has had a rough start. He was found in a pound and about to be put down (due to over crowding), when a woman saved him. She had no place to take him but could not let him die! She decided to board him at a vetâ€™s office, in hopes she would be able to find him a home. Jack ended up staying there for over a year. Poor, Jack sat in a cage (3 x 6), in hopes someone would take him. We happened to be at the vetâ€™s office and asked the owners about him and they ended up giving Jack to us! He had no contact with people or other dogs for a very long time. This is a progress in work. Jack is a good boy, and is a well-behaved dog, obedient and eager to please. He needs a guardian who is familiar with the Bully breed, who will work with him. He has a moderate energy level, but can be rambunctious (so no small children). We are sure you will fall in love. Jack needs a good family who will give him the love he deserves. Is that with you?

name: Star
description:
Please contact Dusti (poochheavenvolunteer@gmail.com) for more information about this pet.

Star is a 11 year old, 53 lbs Shepherd mix. She was rescued by a Pooch Heaven volunteer after months of convincing the owners to give her to us. She was kept chained up as an outside dog (started when she was a pup) with minimal contact. Finally they gave her to us, we are still working on getting the other dogs from them. Star is happy to be free and is looking for a forever home and family. She is great with other dogs and any family would be lucky to have her as their companion. Star is sweet, playful and affectionate. Since being in our care she has been spayed, microchipped and vaccinated. All Star needs now is a family to love!

name: Carson
description:
Is this a face to love, or what !! Carson is a handsome little Pekingese boy, about 9 and 1/2 years old.

Carson was brought into rescue from an area shelter. In the noise and fear at the shelter he nipped at a shelter worker, so he could not be adopted from there. We have found that Carson is blind in his left eye from an untreated ulcer (most likely). If approached from his blind side in unfamiliar surroundings he may have attempted to protect himself. Since he came to rescue he has made no attempt to nip anyone.
 
Carson has been neutered for many years. He has had all his vaccinations and has been checked for heartworm (which was negative). He is currently receiving drops in his blind eye to relieve irritation. He doesn't mind this treatment at all and the drops are very inexpensive. On March 18th, 2009 the folds under his eyes were surgically reduced to cut down on irritation to his eyes.

Carson is social enough with the other dogs and cats in rescue. He can be cranky if he thinks they are thinking about crawling into bed with him - he sleeps alone .... unless it's his idea. He will crawl in with Vinnie on occasion. He is just fine with the cats. He is fairly cautious around new people. He seems to identify with our bashful boy, Vinnie. Carson is house trained and uses the doggie door faithfully. However, he has been known to mark when new dogs are coming in to rescue. Carson is leash trained and loves to go walking with you.  He is frightened of thunderstorms, something we had not noticed until this spring. He loves to be held, loved and talked to.  You will notice that Carson has a new summer haircut - which he likes alot.

K9HAVEN Rescue requires an adoption application, references and a home visit prior to adoption. Rescue requires a fenced yard (no underground fencing, please), and an adoption contract. We prefer a home without young children due to the blindness in his one eye. Carson's adoption fee is $75. K9HAVEN Rescue is a 501(c)3 rescue, and Carson's adoption fee is tax deductible.

If you can't adopt at this time, maybe you would like to sponsor Carson during his stay in rescue. On PetFinder, please click on the "Sponsor" tab at the top of the page.

name: Tom Tom
breed: Domestic Short Hair / Tuxedo / Mixed (short coat)
description:
Please contact Chris (chrisncats@gmail.com) for more information about this pet.



 


My name is Tom Tom and I was rescued after I had received a bad bite wound on my front leg. I'm all recovered now and am ready to find my forever home. I was living on the street and being fed by a nice lady who feeds feral cats, but I'm not feral! I am really, really sweet! Just look at my face - how could you resist me?! I tested positive for the Feline Immunodeficiency Virus (FIV) but that doesn't mean I won't live a long and healthy life. I'm very healthy now and hope to be for a long time. I could be your only cat, or live with other FIV + cats, or even with cats that don't have FIV because of my gentle disposition. Why not give me a chance? Rescue me for a second time - and for forever!

If you are interested in adopting Tom Tom, please contact Chris at 210-232-2790. Sorry, we do not ship our cats, provide any transportation, or do out of state adoptions.

Adoption Process: We require all potential adopters to fill out an adoption application prior to setting up an appointment to visit with the cat(s). We conduct veterinary and personal reference checks during the application approval process. If you email us, we will provide you with an application - either by email or by mail.

name: Chance
breed: Tabby / Domestic Short Hair / Mixed (short coat)
description:
Chance came to us barely alive, he was just a skeleton with fur. You could see in his eyes that he had given up. We believe that he was just a short time from death. He didnt really have the strength to eat dry food and barely nibble on canned. So we hand fed him until he began to eat on his own and each day we watched him get stronger and stronger and the will to live return. He is a bit timid at first but who could blame him, he has been through so much in his young life. He is wonderfully affectionate when he learns to trust a person; when the shelter closes at night and things are quiet, he will approach whoever is still hanging around and climb right into the first available lap; he is unbelievably sweet, and he's never aggressive with the other cats.  Chance, boy, born approx 08/08.

HELP Humane is a non-profit TRUE No Kill animal shelter currently run on individual donations and fundraising alone. (just south of Kansas City). All HELP animals are treated by veterinarians, receive age appropriate vaccinations, dewormed, spayed/neutered and those incoming after Oct 2005, have been micro chipped. Cats have been FeLV/FIV tested and are negative unless otherwise stated. Dogs have been heartworm tested and are on heartworm preventative. We have been told by many adopters that the reason they liked adopting from us is because we have a happy place and all the cats are the friendliest ones they had ever met. HELP Humane believes that all life is precious and is therefore, a TRUE No Kill shelter. We have many FIV and FeLV+ cats in our care. They will live with us until they end their life’s journey or find a permanent home. Come Visit Us! Our hours of operation are Tuesday - Friday, 1pm - 8pm, Saturday 10am - 6pm, Sunday 12pm - 5pm, closed on Monday. 511 Main St. Belton, MO 64012 816-318-HELP www.helppets.org Adoption fees vary according to the needs of the animal up for adoption.

name: Noel
description:
Outside

Noel's story is no different than any of the others.  She was dumped by the side of the road in a box with 2 babies.  She has been at the Olive Branch a long time.  Noel is a very nice sociable cat that loves attention.  She is altered, current on her vaccinations.  She is currently outside, but all the cats also have cat condo accomodations that is heated along with a screened in porch area.  She is litter trained.  She would do well in the house, becoming a princess and couch potato.

Won't you consider giving Noel a loving forever home, she sure does deserve to know the love of a family.

name: Mace
breed: Labrador Retriever / Pit Bull Terrier / Mixed (short coat)
description:
Mace is around 10 ½ Years old and a Labrador mix. He was owner surrender to our Shelter. Mace is shy at first but warms up fast. Mace loves to cuddle and give kisses as well as sit in your lap. Mace loves his blanket and will carry it all over his kennel. Mace has a thick, black coat with a sheen to it and very soft. He loves water and will take over the pools.  Mace loves the volunteers and is a bit goofy trying to get attention. He seems to like the dogs he knows best but will need some supervision when meeting new dogs. Mace will need some patience and instruction on housebreaking as he has been with us several years.

 Our shelter is located at 11901 S. Coulter.  Amarillo SPCA can be reached at 806-622-0555.

name: Delilah
breed: Calico / Domestic Short Hair / Mixed (short coat)
description:
Application, References and Adoption Fee Required

Please visit us at www.KittyColony.org for more information about our rescue.

 


***EXPERIENCED CAT OWNERS ONLY***

Hey there, Delilah! That's what my foster mommy always says to me. 'Course, that is my name. I'm about 9 years old and I was rescued from a feral colony near Horsham. Now I'm looking for my forever indoor home!

I have to admit, I'm pretty shy at first with new people and new surroundings. But I'm extremely curious and like to know everything going on, so I'm certain I'd get used to my new family fairly quickly. I'm already friends with my foster mommy. I love when she pets my head and scratches my back.  Even though I'm a little shy, I'm still a great girl. I promise. And if you give me a chance, you'll know all about me just like my foster mommy.

*Delilah has grown up in foster care and is still quite shy due to being in overcrowded foster homes.  She still deserves a chance for a forever family.  Could she become part of your furry family?   

 


 


Please visit our sweet kitties at the Fruitville Pike Petsmart in Lancaster, PA on Saturdays from 1:30-3:30pm. 

If you are interested in a specific cat or kitten, please email first to see if it will be shown that day.

Please email us at kittycolony@hotmail.com for more information.

Kitty Colony is a 501c3 non profit organization and all donations are tax deductible.

name: Autumn
breed: Dilute Calico / Domestic Medium Hair / Mixed (medium coat)
description:
I have a very aristocratic look and the attitude that goes with it! I love to be the boss!! I have the most beautiful, large green eyes and I do have a shorter tail. And yes, I do come with attitude plus!! I was born in 2005 and so have just turned 12 years old.

I have been at the Adoption Center for several years now and I would love to find a home of my own, unfortunately I don’t know how to go about it! I love to lie in laps but you can only pet around my head as I am very sensitive around my tail and hips and I will give you a little nip to let you know do not touch!

When in a foster home I loved to sleep in bed with my foster mom and on top of her head was the best place! I would enjoy being in the same room as my person.

I am still playful and will have spurts of energy. Age is starting to catch up to me and I am slowing down and am starting to enjoy a warm place to nap and canned food more than playing with toys.

I would be best as an only cat and often my attitude can be ornery because of the other cats here at the Adoption Center. I am also not fond of dogs and older children would be best. I need to find a home that will appreciate my cat-attitude!

There are signs that I do have arthritis in my hips and as I get older may need supplements or medication for this problem. While these are not extremely expensive, they will be an additional cost to help keep me healthy and pain free and my new owners would need to be prepared for this.

My adoption fee is $40.  I have been spayed, micro chipped, tested negative for FELV/FIV, and vaccinated for distemper and rabies.  I have had a few dentals and now have annual senior blood panels run to make sure I am healthly.

You can see me at our Adoption Center at 8901 E Trent, Ste 101 (corner of Argonne and Trent, next to Albertson's) or call 509-893-9829 if interested.
descriptionPlain:
I have a very aristocratic look and the attitude that goes with it! I love to be the boss!! I have the most beautiful, large green eyes and I do have a shorter tail. And yes, I do come with attitude plus!! I was born in 2005 and so have just turned 12 years old.

 I have been at the Adoption Center for several years now and I would love to find a home of my own, unfortunately I don’t know how to go about it! I love to lie in laps but you can only pet around my head as I am very sensitive around my tail and hips and I will give you a little nip to let you know do not touch!

 When in a foster home I loved to sleep in bed with my foster mom and on top of her head was the best place! I would enjoy being in the same room as my person.

 I am still playful and will have spurts of energy. Age is starting to catch up to me and I am slowing down and am starting to enjoy a warm place to nap and canned food more than playing with toys.

 I would be best as an only cat and often my attitude can be ornery because of the other cats here at the Adoption Center. I am also not fond of dogs and older children would be best. I need to find a home that will appreciate my cat-attitude!

 There are signs that I do have arthritis in my hips and as I get older may need supplements or medication for this problem. While these are not extremely expensive, they will be an additional cost to help keep me healthy and pain free and my new owners would need to be prepared for this.

 My adoption fee is $40. I have been spayed, micro chipped, tested negative for FELV/FIV, and vaccinated for distemper and rabies. I have had a few dentals and now have annual senior blood panels run to make sure I am healthly.

name: Magic
description:
Magic is one of four pups found in the woods. Magic is friendly, playful and is ready for her forever, loving home. One thing you need to know about Magic, this girl can jump.  If she is outside at all, you'll need to keep an eye on her and have a very tall fence, or she may disappear - "just like magic".  She's very gentle! She enjoys walks and playing with others! She's friendly and super sweet with all the volunteers! Dont let the gray around her face fool you! Shes young at heart along with her siblings and she has a lot of love to give for many more years! You will love this girl! She has been at WARM way too long and would love the chance to be in a good home! 
DOB - Approx. Feb, 08.

name: Tequila
description:
Tequila is a beautiful brown tabby femalewith eyes that are a

lovely shade of green. This girl isexceptionally sweet.  Tequila

is 11 years old.  She was adopted from Animal Aid as a

young cat, returned recently because her person became

very ill and went into rehab. She was no longer able to take

care of her beloved pet. Tequila is sweet and does very well

with other cats. As a young senior, Tequila, has the

best years of her life ahead of her and would like to spend

them with someone she can love forever and who will love and care for her.  She is a super friendly, lovely domestic cat who will make a great companion. YOU CAN MEET HER AT OUR CENTER AT 571 NE44th St. (NW corner of Prospect (44th and 6th) in Oakland Park, FL. 

We encourage you to file an on line application for this or any of our pets by clicking HERE or by going to www.animal-aid.com for a Pet Adoption Application.  Please include the name of the cat(s) or kitten(s). Stop by anytime when we're open.  Please visit our web site at www.animal-aid.com to see the hours for our Adoption Center located at 571 NE44th St. (NW corner of Prospect (44th and 6th) in Oakland Park, FL 33334 and our pets available for adoption. Many of our cats are shown 7 days a week at the Petsmart at 12051 Sunrise in Plantation, and the  Petco at 8111 West Broward Blvd. in Plantation. The donation we are requesting is $60 and includes our medical program; all vaccines, rabies vaccine, fecal exam, de-worming, blood test for AIDS and Leukemia, spay or neuter, first month Advantage (flea treatment) plus a coupon for Science Diet food.

name: Athena
description:
I am a perfect medium sized baby doll with a beautiful brindle coat. I am a stray brought in by the pound, and since I have a pit bull look and very very playful, I could only go to a rescue group. So I am with Blue HAWK just a lookin' for a home, just a lookin' for a home. 
I am housebroken, but not good with small children.  I do well with some dogs, would just have to meet them and see and when I get to know you, I LOVE YOU.  For info. on adoption bluehawkorg@gmail.com
